M3nyQl_mCClQZVYj0F6KNA.text: The potstickers are amazing!!! Love the Pineapple Fried Rice and Pad Thai as well. Orders are always ready on time and quick when I place a pick up order!

MHO-Q6I2wFxoWzeokbjRXQ.text: I come here often since it's close to my house. Lately, the service hasn't been great and the food isn't as good, but I still liked it. Yesterday, 1/6/17 I was there with my friend and our chicken was completely pink on the inside. Make sure your food is thoroughly cooked if you come here.

JMSL5FuHVM7ZDfNThREscA.text: I eat Thai food pretty often, we were looking for a new place to try and decided on this one for its great reviews. First off the person answering the phone for pickup barely spoke English and didn't understand us trying to order a pick up. Then they said it would be 15-20 minutes and when we headed over at that Time we still had to wait. The food wasn't even ready.  After another 15 minutes it's ready so we left. When we got home to eat the food mine was not great- I had the pad see ew. The noodes felt like a plastic material and the sauce  was off. I personally wouldnt eat here again even I just for that reason.   It's also in an awkward location so unless you live next door don't bother making the trip. It's pretty north west a random parking lot in the corner. You probably need to know where you are headed as well.

Oh-ud82ysQixJu8BWSRElA.text: Delicious take-out Thai food. Pad Thai was okay... But really enjoyed the fried rice with Chinese sausage and pork. The Panang Beef sauce was delish!!!  Also get the chicken basil. Makes a perfect pairing with Pad Thai and steamed rice drizzle with Panang curry sauce. That's how you eat Thai food folks!  35 bucks = 3 dishes and comfortably fed four people.

1gv46irLPtwmpcNfG5MIcA.text: I've eaten at  just about every thai place in town literally  and this is my favorite, the prices are awesome the portions are very generous and most importantly the food is amazing. Not a single bad experience here. I eat here about twice a week. Wish i can give 6/5 stars

Ci5UFXH0pkyNlBR3cjH0_g.text: Mediocre at best! Chairs were dirty that you sat in that should have been a sign! Servers we're both rude put out if you asked for anything such as water refill or clean plate! Overcharged on the food we ordered and the food was very bland! Spicy eggplant was good mixed vegetables with chicken horrible with no flavor! First time and last time! If you want the best Thai food in town go to WEERA on west Sahara

I7FgrW-c4eI7nkczEpcW9Q.text: The kitchen here is so fast and the prices are so good that you almost expect the food to be sub-par, but it's not. The food is good.  Pot Sticker Appetizer 5/5 Crispy and delicious, topped with sushi-like sauces and fresh spring onions. Highly recommended.   Green Papaya Salad 5/5 Fresh shredded green papaya, tomatoes,  cabbage on the side. Spicy fish sauce dressing is awesome, but maybe a bit hot for some. Ask for mild if you're not a big fan of heat.  Pad Thai with Chicken 5/5 Perfectly cooked al dente noodles, fresh crispy bean sprouts, delicious pad thai sauce, juicy chicken.  Very impressed with everything here, especially for the price. Will be back for more!

aoueO-hhlJ31bfg1TCHs_g.text: A great place!! The chicken red curry is fantastic. The workers are so welcoming and helpful. I feel lucky that this is close to home, its easy for carry out and sitting in there is pleasant too. Excellent place check it out!!

6ExhS2kEINvPIp3D11OX7Q.text: My favorite place to eat right now. Always get the same thing and im always happy. Only complaint is i wish they had a location closer to alliante area.

2FD9d-Csh89Hord0KF2syw.text: Good food. Not expensive at all. Ordered Pad Thai, Orange chicken and sweet and sour pork. It wasn't bad. Orange chicken was delicious! So was sweet and sour pork... but it didn't have very much pork, it was more vegetables. And Pad Thai was decent. It was more spicy than flavorful, I've had better Pad Thai for sure. I will come back to try other menu items since this was our first visit.

IweSQfvzvVK8wDPgPAwSlw.text: As for so many other incredible "gem" finds, I have a trusted Yelp bud to thank for this one. Feeling under the weather a few months ago and craving spicy soup, I turned to my foodie Jedi Master, Kevin P for sage (and nearby) wisdom. Of course, he knew that this Chinatown staple had opened in our hood. Shares a car park with Smith's/German Bread Bakery, etc @ Rampart and Lake Mead.   They do deliver, but a GF was kind enough to bring me spicy noodle soup (ordered 10/10 was more Ike an 8, but hit the spot) Like the original, they are known for their duck and it is an add on in many dishes; carnivore friends love it, not my thing. Drunken Noodles are a favorite and tasty and their curries are delicious. Really love that they inquire if you are vegan when you ask a dish to be prepared meat free and their willingness to change dishes for those of us who have restrictions.   The value cannot be overstated: you easily get two meals from every portion here without compromising great taste. The decor is pretty, service is charming and on point and by now we all know the restroom is outside. Dining in is a lovely experience as the dying art of customer service with a smile abounds here.   Over the course of several months, we've  ordered them in for Board Meetings, spontaneous gatherings and take and go a half dozen times. Everyone is equally astonished at location, quality and ROI.   Almost glad to have had whatever the strange malady was which haunted my first week or so of year, as Kevin directed me to a clearly outstanding and unassuming place I'll continue to patronize and suggest to others. Now that they know me, I get my 10/10 spicy level and more. Welcome addition to the hood fo sho!  Yelp 100 Challenge

yH6jKnHb9aKcA_Irkdk3tQ.text: It was crazy, stupid delicious. I felt like I was betraying my favorite Thai restaurant in town cause this place has a spot in my heart now.  Was immediately greeted and seated as we walked in. She even put the sun shade down for the boyfriend & I since it was a little sunny. 1 Star!  Ordered our mandatory Thai Teas, in those large beer mugs. Truly appreciate the amount of ice, some places overload it and it gets watery. Sweetness was on point too. 2 Stars!   Food came right after, Chicken Satay, Chicken Pad Thai (Spice level 6) & BBQ Pork over Fried Rice. Dear lawd, I almost blurted "Now THATS how it's supposed to be damnit!" So delicious!!! Chicken skewers had just enough spice and really complemented the peanut sauce. I even put the sauce in my pad Thai. And speaking of that Pad Thai, holy sssshhhhhh, it was everything & more. Spicy but tolerable. Noodles were so flavorful. Chicken was perfectly seasoned. Then the rice and pork BBQ was delicious! The man enjoyed the sweet chili sauce that comes with it while I enjoyed the sweet soy sauce. 3 Stars!  Ended the meal with Sticky Rice & Mangoes. It was really sweet, even the mango. Rice could be softer but I loved it anyway. 4 Stars!  Service was so friendly and quick too. Oh and the prices were so ridiculously cheap.   And that leads me to 5 Stars! Can't wait to try their amazing lunch special too!

mLCUSCH8nrOBIMAfTeJSpA.text: So I used to go here a lot  1- because it is close to work 2- it has decent authentic Thai cooking 3- reasonably priced lunch menu   today.. I decided to order for delivery. I called at 11 (right when they opened), ordered my food, and the lady said there was going to a $2 charge for delivery because they charge $1 per mile. I don't mind paying it but across the street is not 2 miles, Google maps says the place is 0.4 miles. Then on top of that they said it would take 45 mins for the food. Why? You just opened.. It takes about 10-15 to cook it, and its only 5 min drive to the office.   Instead of convenience, I'm now going to make the drive down the street to another restaurant.

mjVOEdCNGDdbfp7n1Sb46g.text: Unfortunately the portions have gotten so small it's not worth the money coming here anymore.. used to come here all the time but they've cut back on portions ... barely any meat in the dishes and the lunch special is so small I'd rather pay 2 dollars more at Archie's and get a MEAL than a couple bites... very disappointed since this was one of my favorites.. will not be returning.

OaucPID8FaB_nYWiRZp72A.text: I am really starting to like Thai Style Noodle House.  I have never been disappointed with the food and service last night was top notch.  I was talked into trying the chicken pot stickers and I am glad it happened.  They were awesome.  For a place that serves food relatively quickly and at a good price I was not expecting an appetizer dish to look so appealing.  6 dumplings lined up and topped with two sauces, soy and some sort of seasoned mayonaise.  Add to that green onions and sesame seeds and what a nice treat to add to my main entree order of pad see-eu.  That was good too.  I had a craving for flat rice noodles and this hit the spot.   You better believe I will be back many more times.

sF4F3QWRCZvdaOZY_6eKaA.text: I got the green curry and it was delicious, but I ordered it a few levels too spicy and couldn't handle it lol. Totally my fault, not theirs.   Our server was extremely nice and made conversation with us in between orders. The restaurant looks a little dated but it's clean.   Try the Thai tea- it's perfectly sweetened without being overly so.   Nice little spot to get my Thai food fix!

jQhZHhhAR4DguP2rotauMw.text: Orange chicken was delicious. Super light and crispy with not too much sauce. Very yummy.   Chicken pad Thai wasn't bad. It was pretty good but not the best I've had. My mom ordered it 5/10 for spice and it was far too spicy for her. I got a 2 and it was just right for me.. I'm a spice wimp.   Fried wanton appetizer was quite tasty. Extremely crispy on the verge of being a little overcooked, but it was OK.  Service was good. Cup was never empty which is a plus. Its a small place but was enjoyable. I'd go back because the food was great for the prices. Serving sizes were pretty large for the $6-$7 price per dinner plate.

2XmRkYnn5Na-YoWyW2spFw.text: We were surprised that this one was cute compared to the more hole in the wall original location.   The BF and I shared the pineapple curry with shrimp. The curry was red curry coconut base which was decent. It was a bit too tangy for me, but it was well made and had a good amount in shrimp, pineapple and veggies in it. It comes with just a cup of rice, we had to ask for another cup, which is extra per cup.   Spicy Thai noodles - think of it similar to pad se ew, but with other veggies like cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, onions in it. It wasn't very spicy though. In fact, they didn't ask us about our spice level at all, but maybe then they assumed to go mild. I should probably ask next time.   For the portions, these were cheap... a few dollars less than the average going rate. The flavor I thought was decent. I don't know what it was about it, but I rarely get heartburn and did. It was odd is all.   Service was just OK. We came an hour before their closing (20 minutes before closing is kitchen last call) and when we entered they kinda seemed a bit bummed we showed. They weren't the most attentive given we were the only ones there, but there were take out orders coming through still. I had to walk up to get my bill since the 3 people in the front were all busy doing something. The food came out lightening fast which was a plus, but also was maybe so we can get done fast.   I was confused how this place didn't have a bathroom, but I thought sitting there how weird that was. I did see on some peoples reviews there IS a bathroom. You just have to walk to it on the side or something.   There's several items on the menu that is unique to them, combined with a great pricepoint that makes it a good cheap option that's in a convenient of a area for us. I'm sure we will be back for more bites.

E9YaIx8xD4T3G-_M2NnLZw.text: I ate at this place as a regular, and used to order delivery from their Chinatown location more often than I'd like to admit since 2011 or 12. Back then, my review would be 4 or 5 stars.  Then came the day where they put big ol hunks of CHICKEN in my vegetarian spicy eggplant with fried tofu!!!! And now, I just literally can't even...  So if you are veg inclined, do exercise caution.

AR5kqUVeB_gmczkrLtIdHw.text: I had lunch here and my chicken was raw!!! Waitress did not even apologize and just said, "Oh." Horrible service. Eat at your own risk!!!!!!

TtjCXycc4YEN48TMx-PmnA.text: The food was good I ordered the ground chicken with basil .The service on the other hand was poor. The waitress seemed annoyed while taking our order I would have given this place four stars, but I really didn't enjoy the "overall" of the place because of the service.

cCI8YjDemcAdQZ-TZr04mw.text: I usually like it here, but for the second time in a row now there was hair in my food. Not just one little tiny hair, but a long hair. I called to complain they weren't that apologetic. Disappointed and disgusted.

Nq1W8ee8Ha9ap45GtNRgvg.text: By far the worst chicken noodle soup I have ever had in my life. The chicken didn't even look natural.. It was in like balled up chucks and the oily water broth tasted only of onion. I took 1 bite and was done.

egGB1PYYjTPzD9s0lr7Dww.text: Yummy and deliciously spicy!!! We order tum yum soup (chicken), papaya salad and Thai beef ball noodle soup all were soooooooo gooood!!! Would recommend to anyone who loves spice and flavors. Service was quick and meal prep was fast. Reasonable price.

udNhn5rPUfI_q8QzxUWSqg.text: I was on my way home and I stopped at Smith's to pick up groceries, and in the parking lot I saw it.  The bright neon open sign was almost calling my name, that neon open sign knew I didn't want to go home and cook, it knew I wanted and needed fresh, fast, and quality Thai food. I ordered chicken Pad See Eu, OH MY!!! I was so good.  I soon invented reasons to be on that side of town to eat there, actually get take out from there.  As you read this review don't just think about going, experience it for yourself!!

-ZU_mUiPgxWHD4mzwKtspg.text: We come here a couple times a week.. The food is delicious but inconsistent. The staff is NOT accommodating.. Even for regulars. Sometimes Victor from the Tropicana location is there helping out and he is great.. But most of the staff is rude. The last couple of times we've been in, it has been inconsistent.  We always order the soup..and last time we were shorted on broth.. They made up an excuse that they were changing the portions.. However, today it was back to being the normal portion.. I found a long, curly HAIR in my soup and not only did they charge me for the entire thing (minus a measly 10% for the inconvenience ) but they didn't even offer to remake it for me! I feel that they should have taken care of us..but there wasn't even an apology! We asked to speak to a manager but there were none on duty.. (Apparently, there is never a manager on duty! Who knows what else they do to the food?!) When we told our server that we weren't satisfied with our experience, she was rude, unaccommodating and uncaring. We told her we won't be back and that they just lost some good clients to which she said  "Ok."

xXW21G2p3z8fOgr9ufM8Ww.text: Amazing! Fresh, tasty Thai food & it won't break your wallet! Great value, great portions. I originally ate at the restaurant in Chinatown & this food here at Noodle House 3 is just as great. Get some!

ByYM-Ee2YqjwsJqjr1DBJg.text: Excellent food.  Large portions at affordable prices.  Very casual - not much ambiance.  Will definitely eat here again.

XBmzSuN9QXdBXt-1LRYNzw.text: First time for everything.  Interior is pretty nice, for a grocery store shopping center location, its on the corner of Lake Mead and Rampart, but the big Smiths Shopping store, opposite end from the grocery store.   Its on the NW corner.   It was slightly tricky to find.   I asked the 'owner' I assume for her favorite thai soup, she recommended her version of the tom yum, I got it with extra fish balls and spice level 5, since my gut is killing me lately, but I was fine after I slurped this yummy goodness down.  The fishballs tasted and had the texture of scallops, I was amazed, that was a surprise. the rice noodles inside a tom yum broth with some chilis and chili oil flowing over the abiss of broth, fish balls(ASK FOR THIS!) and little bits of meat and shrimps.  My buddy had the Chix Noodle Soup and he said it was the best he has ever had.  I had to ding em up on the service.  Its seat yourself and the girl running the place, seemed very stressed out.   She was there with I needed her, barely, we had to get our own napkins once we slammed are faces into the goodness, but that's elementary for a restaurant, bring me a napkin.  Also, my buddy asked for rice and meat and she had no recommendation, she was silent, maybe it was a language barrier.  A host or something would have helped the whole service standard.  Still, the place has a great atmosphere, they are pretty fast too, and the food is different and very tasty compared to the 100+ thai places I have been too, I will go back again and again....Phob gun Reaw-reaw nee khrup ---translation --See You soon!

CUJVj9So7b8RwigeHbKwLw.text: Roasted duck curry for $8, you have to be kidding.  We have not gone back to any of the neighborhood Chinese take-outs since this location of Thai Noodle opened.   Their prices are extremely reasonable for the quality of food.  If you go to any one of their locations be sure and try the salmon and avocado panang, original and a great balance of flavors.

RUmLNsgo798vP4yM6unLfw.text: Good food, great prices. Most of the time I get theirs Lunch special, 2 items for 8$, and I have enough left overs for another lunch.

n46o_FcRRvxUrugcu8KFqA.text: NEVER DISAPPOINTS!!!!! Not only is the food terrific, the customer service and staff are the best.  If you are not a regular yet, once you go you will be part of the family.

2BVP_ZG_aM7qiSdmD6ttag.text: I hate being so negative, but this is for those who care about service and cleanliness, both of which were sorely lacking today. The chairs, for starters, looked like they were attacked by someone's pet lion. The floors looked like they might get mopped once a week with layers of dirt and footprints visible along with the added ambiance of strewn straw wrappers and gunk galore. The rectangular overhead vent was caked with visible dust. The windows were also filthy. The waitresses sat by the counter talking to one another through the meal, so I had to get up to ask for chopsticks and for more tea. That is not really the big deal, but a family of four came in after us and were seated at a filthy table that had not been cleaned off or wiped down before they were seated. If the place was buzzing, there would still be no excuse, but the place was just about empty. Instead of socializing and ignoring the customers, the help could have made sure the tables and the floor were clean. The shame of it is the food was very tasty, but I am grateful I did not see the kitchen.

tN-PTCOnBqXFOP4bWCpWPg.text: I'm so glad I finally found a perfect Thai restaurant near summerlin area. Awesome food, clean and good service!!!!  Oh did I mentioned good $????

c7B2C98uqaC9n6nVOp_lFg.text: best tai food I ever had so far!  and ? price is awesome.  wish there is something like this in San diego

ID7yjmfZVva2WVc6MunjCA.text: This little gem is my favorite Thai place! The staff is super friendly, and always helpful with anything I ask for.  A cozy atmosphere; this place is good for one, two or small groups of 8-10. They serve many different Thai dishes and the following are some of my favorites: Papaya Salad Silver Noodle Salad Pad Thai Both the Red and Green Curry Duck Fried Rice Three Companion Pork Tom Ka- chicken Tom Yum   This far everything I've ordered from this place is delicious AND full of Flavor. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for good Thai and great prices!!!

lQ7a2kwU46RoVj5w9jUSZg.text: Don't know what happened, but the taste has really changed here. I usually go to the one on Trop but used to come to this location in the past. I went today for a quick lunch and got spicy eggplant that was mostly bland and gravy with so much oil, I just paid and left it uneaten. I'm not going back. They said they had a new chef and offered to fix it, but i didn't trust it would get better. Too bad, it used to be a good place. Maybe their other dishes are still good but I won't find out.

t9kvjvi2woBBrZONER0s7g.text: Well. I dont know what to say... except this is the shittiest customer service ever. It's so unbelievable how RUDE the staff is. No greeting. Then they huff and puff when you read the menu. Then huff and puff when you are ordering not in their speed. A customer asked when her soup is ready... they huffed and puffed and told her to just wait. Wow. If they huff and puff any more, they might as well audition for the Three Little Pigs broadway show. Oh before I forget, I asked for a menu and the lady said "it's right there!" and pointed with her lips. What. The. The food better be good cus this is so not worth the trip. People eating in the dining area just sad or upset. We end up to-go'ing or I will snap at these a-holes. I will be back to add more review after we try the food.  Im back to give a food review. Well. It's good. The cook definitely knows what he's doing. Kudos to him! He earned the extra 2 stars. The only way I would come back is if we have the food to-go. Otherwise, just go to Pin Kaow down the street. Now, they have great customer service and delicious food. I just thought to try something new and this place just disappointed us.

q3z1eqX2nuF0nyZU5pJ4Og.text: I like this place always good never had a problem here . Except it just isn't close enough to my house it limits the times I go their.

c0wblE7oJw2Yxd5xkVyN2Q.text: Do yourself a favor and dont come in expecting to get any meat in your dishes and you wont be disappointed. Went in for lunch with hubby today and staff was so abrupt that we decided to get the  food to go. Wait staff acted busy, but no one was there. The girl who took our order was acting like i was wasting her time. No need to have to tell someone off when you  can get the food and go. Ordered fried wontons, chicken  fried rice,  and bbq pork over rice. RIP OFF!!!! Please see my pics of this crap.... you have been warned. Wontons were burnt so burnt they are only good  for scratching itchy gums.  No meat in them but they cost 7 bucks??? Chicken fried rice was decent, the was about a tablespoon of chicken in the whole dish. But the rice was okay... so you get one star Bbq pork was flavorless and tough, real tough almost like jerky but bigger and more expensive.  I came here because the reviews were decent but now im thinking folks in this area are just used to settling for what they can get.  I wont be back, wouldn't recommend and will steer folks  away from...

m5-ubfsTPNwcJ32fiRHjMQ.text: Thai style noodle house is my absolute go-to place.  It is clean, affordable, and has tasty food.   My favorites:  - crab rangoon  -  crispy noodle with wonton  - chicken fried rice (for a healthier alternative I sub it with brown rice)   I have never been dissatisfied with this place!

KkxVYibk-AQJsUic6KYW-w.text: I used to love this place dearly. Unfortunately the last couple times I have gone the service has been lackluster and the staff has been rude. If you ask for something as simple as veggies added to a dish they charge a few dollars extra and throw in a couple onions slices and a stem of broccoli. The food just tastes like they use off-cuts in everything and cheaper recipes for their dishes now. There's more spice than flavor. It just seems like they've really tried to cut the costs and it's at the customers expense. Like I said I've given it a couple tries after the first bad time and it hasn't improved at all. I wish it wasn't True but this place has gone downhill a lot.

h1lDu4vYt4KnvX2fTC9EPw.text: One of my favorite Thai places in Vegas, especially if I am looking for authentic soup. The location is tiny, and easy to miss if you are not looking for it. No special decor, no dress code. Just real Thai food at it's finest, served by people who know what they are doing.  For appetizers, I love the chicken satay, crab rangoons, and their special style of pot sticker, that is not like your classic gyoza at all. They offer Tom Kha, or Tom Yum, with or without noodle, and you also get to choose between 4 types of noodle. Also, they will totally accommodate special requests. I ordered regular chicken noodle soup, and they made it Thai spicy per my request.  My daughter loves the pineapple fried rice, and gets it every single time we go here. Its a mix of shrimp and chicken, and is not spicy like other dishes. Level 8 is my go to. It's almost unbearable, but still has tons of flavor.  My boyfriend loves the garlic and pepper entree with chicken, and a fried egg.  You can get this as a lunch special as well, smaller portion but at a great price! He gets a level 5 or 6, and its just a tad spicy. Average, if you can't handle it, you shouldn't be eating Thai food!  The curry is also a safe bet, I prefer yellow or panang. Pretty large portions with the dinner, I had to ask for extra rice.  I have never once dined here and not been totally satisfied with my meal, the service, the pricing, and my overall experience. I eventually will step out of my normal routine and try something new!

6x1naTIU_uN9TJpeKOjUUA.text: The lunch specials have a choice of 1 or 2 entre choices. $5.95 For one choice or $7.95 for 2 dishes. I had the Mongolian beef and the cashew nut chicken. It was ok. Nothing special. I have had a lot better. The Mongolian beef was really tough. Very low quality meat. The cashew nut chicken was bland. It had about 5 nuts. I may go there again as I always give two chances to get it right. But with that said I will not make a special effort to do so.  The service was not good. I had to keep asking for a refill of my ice tea. It was not busy and my waiter was just standing around.  The prices were good. It is the only reason I have them 3 stars.

LmWzBD0CwyXWq3LUBr1_Uw.text: I've been to this business twice.  The most recent time I ordered chicken satay to go.  It was very good, but not my favorite.  The recipe and preparation is slightly different than my preferred satay, but it is still good.  A small peanut sauce and cucumber salad is part of the satay order and they are tasty as well.  It is in the same shopping center as a grocery store I frequent which makes it convenient, but it's not my first choice for Thai food.  The staff were pleasant and went  back to check on my order a couple of times.  The satay order was presented to me hot wrapped in aluminum foil.

xX-ah4m5seit5ZnSKHXFug.text: My boyfriend and I go here at least 2x a week!  Our favorites: Sliced beef noodle soup with small rice noodles and the yellow chicken curry.  The entrees taste exactly the same, every time we order! Is it sad that the servers know our orders?

ae6OmLqWa4QoIjKhSrtV_Q.text: This is a take out sport for sure. I wanted to sit down and they tried to sit us at the table the worker had been sitting at playing on his cell phone. When I asked if they had something away from the door because it was very cold, they said that they had already closed the dining side(more than two hours before closing). He sat us away from the door but then we had a bout five different servers come over and try and take our order when we had barely looked at the menu. We were kind of rushed. When our food came out my boyfriend tasted mine and said "this has an interesting flavor, but I don't want to tell you what it is(he knew I'd send it back or not eat it) a few bites in I figure out that they had burnt my food and scraped it out of the pan as I found the "char" and saw black pieces floating around in my noodles. I just paid and got out of there. I will never be back.

mYvutEEZoWsbwo566DwCOA.text: The food here is inexpensive and decent quality. I come here often and every time is a different experience. The food is great and fast but the only complaint is their service. The customer service is very poor and they should definitely work on it.

mvHyY5oIbR6OFAiMbgPeTQ.text: Im trying to call to order for pick up, called about 8 times seeing if it was the right number. They "answered" but no one said anything for 10 minutes. I just heard the restaurant noise. Sucks! I know the food is good. You missed out on a 8 person order.

ZSfuZaPo93sSCUrgCZSvOg.text: RUN, DON'T WALK from this truly terrible neighborhood Thai restaurant.  Just about the worst service I've ever had in Las Vegas.   Each person in our party of six ordered their own food individually.   It was NOT a family-style or shared or buffet style order.   Yet they brought out the dishes one by one, with each plate brought out several minutes after the last, So no one could eat at the same time.  They also did not bring out any silverware or extra plates for people who'd not yet been served, so it was impossible for people who'd been served to share with people still waiting for food.  They forgot about my order entirely.   After being reminded twice to bring out my food, it finally arrived after everyone else had finished about half their meal.  So I ended up having to take most of my meal home, because others were done eating well before me.  To add insult injury, they then took it upon themselves to add an 18% tip to the bill, but then hid this from me by bringing me a credit card slip with a blank for a tip, obviously hoping to get tipped twice.  When we complained that the horrible service did not justify an 18% tip, they refused to lower it or remove it, claiming that they impose a mandatory 18% tip on groups of six.  The food is strictly ho-hum, mediocre, middle of the road. Nothing special about the food.   I don't judge a restaurant by the decor, but the decor in this place is truly hideous, chaotic and disconnected. There's nothing even remotely Asian (or, for that matter, tasteful) about the decor.  For a better and more authentic Thai experience in the neighborhood, with excellent service, excellent food and beautiful decor, go instead to Pin Kaow on W. Lake Mead Blvd. and rainbow Boulevard

wUdYcwoBns3cXNPMIiuO6A.text: First time trying this place!  Hit the spot!  Wanted authentic Thai noodle, this was great!  Seafood, chicken chopped, pork, fish balls, fish cake...  DELISH!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodle House Tom yum noodle soup... Very tasty!!  Great price... Highly recommend it!  Medium spicy was just right!

trOyvejs0XOGhw7IIZ9MBQ.text: Good golly, if it weren't for my co-workers asking one another, "where do you wanna go for lunch?" and defaulting to Thai food 3 to 4 times a week, I probably wouldn't come to Thai Noodle House as often as I do.  Items on the menu are reasonably priced whether you go ala carte or go with a lunch combo.  If you have an hour for lunch and you're withn 4-miles of this particular location, the service is quick that you can sit, enjoy your meal, and back to work on time..

Fysi-Fpe63xm8oa-TgUm8g.text: Okay, so I thought it would be super yummy ! Nah !.. It's okay.  Had the coconut milk with noodles  Super pricey ! Didn't get a breakdown of charges  Service SUCKS!!  Gave me my to go order and damm utensils or napkins. Not what I expected ....  NO TIP for YOU !

5dUW84UAhDpNX528noWR0w.text: I'm so happy I gave this Thai Noodle House another try because it has now become my favorite take-out!  A sore throat brought me in yearning for something warm and comforting to sooth it.  I ordered the sliced beef Thai noodle soup bowl with wide noodles and the hubby ordered the mixed beef with ramen noodles.    I would advise the sliced beef if you're ordering this dish. The mixed beef has some mushroom looking cuts that resemble liver so for me the sliced beef was the winner.   I got it to-go.  However, if you stay in and dine.  Check your good table manners at the door and forget everything your momma taught you because this delicious slurpable broth with loads of flavor, crunchy fresh bamboo shoots and bok choy nesting on top will leave you slurping and licking your bowl dry while begging for more. That is if you can finish it-because the serving is PLENTY for TWO.  My secret:  Add some lime to the broth it will add and enhance the flavor.  Go get your noodle soup now!

kWrcLPyjSKFlNQ1-iTMsGw.text: My friend and I picked up food from the Rampart location today and we thought the woman doing the take-out food was quite rude. When getting the food home we noticed that the crab rangoons did not have a bit of crab in any of them. We paid $8 for cream cheese filled pastrys that were not that great. The Thai curry saved the meal. It was the right amount of spicy, chicken was tender and delicious, and veggies the perfect softness. The chicken pad Thai was okay, but my friend told me it's not as good as The brown rice Thai kitchen. All in all, this place is okay, but didnt blow us away. We may order from here again because the price was right and the chicken curry was good, but we won't be ordering the "crab" Rangoons again. The reason I didn't give it 4 stars was do to the service and crab rangoons. If we have a better experience next time I may change my rating.

_l52zohRjbPklq3oFpPDOQ.text: This place is perfect.  I don't understand how you could review this place anything less than 5 stars. It's extremely delicious, the portions are large, and the price is unbelievably cheap. Should be illegal how cheap it is. I often tip extra just because I don't think the price is fair. My favorite thing is basil leaf fried rice and pork jerky.

dGgtKdHtmyBfGXpUphmkXA.text: I've tried all 3 locations and this location wins best decor.  The food is pretty much the same at all locations with the two outside of Chinatown being newer and cleaner in appearance.  Thai Style is my favorite Thai spot outside of the pricier Lotus of Siam.  I think the options are a better value than say Archie's for the typical Thai fare, with some options you might not see at some of the more generic Thai restaurants. Some of my favorite dishes are the beef/pork jerky with this amazing sweet/salty/sour dipping sauce.  The Moo Tod (fried pork) over fried rice is also delicious, with the pork being fried with a hint of sweetness.  The pork comes over a heaping portion of fried rice.  It also comes with a bland soup...which I generally don't partake in...but I'm told it's a palette cleanser.   My new favorite find has been the Three Companion Pork, which comes with sticky rice, papaya salad, and either pork or chicken.  The papaya salad here is a refreshing option for the Las Vegas summer heat.  It's a blend of green papaya, tomatoes, green beans, and carrots sprinkled with peanuts.  It's a bit spicy even when I ordered it at a level 2 out of 10.  My nose was getting runny while eating it, but I kept going back for more until the dish was empty.  I like that Thai Style also offers duck as an option instead of just chicken/beef/pork.  The duck fried rice and duck pad see ew are delicious.  In the wintertime, I also enjoy the beef noodle soup.  The broth is a dark, thick broth with a variety of beef cuts and beef meat balls.  Most items are $7-9 for a large portion.

01-f3mXnTBy9mU7gY1Evjw.text: If you're looking for a good thai food spot with great prices this is it. Every Curry I've had is good. The tom kha and tom yum soups are always a great start with tons of flavor. And the thai beef salad is delicious.

_bN36nkA3sjfA2TFTawzag.text: Two words: coconut juice. This sweet addition complemented the spicy potstickers (so yummy!) and savory pad see ew perfectly. Everything we ordered was delicious and enjoyable. I often order pad see ew but this was the first time my SO wanted to trade entrees with me. He had the pineapple rice which was great as well. Overall, this is a good option for Thai food in Vegas.

u5eu8ofM-CM_rLSl0q9KPw.text: Love this place! Best Thai food I've had since moving to Vegas. Personal fav is steamed ginger snapper.

ab7XzThYBAgcY112HeGKFQ.text: Khuya Kai noodles are a tasty option. Great flavor and personable staff here at this location. This was my second visit to Thai noodle house and I was pleased. I got chicken this time & not shrimp like last time because the shrimp were dirty/not deveined....yucky! They have a delivery option too that is convenient. Thai tea here is liquid diabetes in disguise (fyi).

3iMxCw-hRnZ-kZX00DSg7w.text: This place was an unexpected gem and recommended especially for those who live in the area.  We had the Guay-Teaiw-Loard, seafood aoup, and pad Thai along with fried banana for dessert.  The portions were fairly big and the food overall was quite tasty.  For a chill atmosphere and family-sized portions, check this place out.

QHAgZ5B4pMvPe3uCZ2ZVUQ.text: Thai is my comfort food... Papaya salad... And Tom yum with shrimp.. (I only eat fish/seafood/tofu)  (a pescetarian).  And the green curry w tofu...This place is hittin.  Delivery will ALWYS get a review from me, so.. Here it is!  Wish they were open later and they DONT have fresh spring rolls... Only fried... Not a plus... Delivery is swift and food hits the spot.  Enjoy!

2NqUUus7mONuIDVU69vMLg.text: I would give them no stars if I could.  They had me wait 20 minutes before they told me that they forgot to put in my order.  But what they didn't forget was to ask me to pay first before forgetting to put in my order.  I was on my lunch break so i asked for my money back and had to go grab something else in a hurry.  They were not only unapologetic but tried to talk me out of canceling the order all together.   Just to add that they don't have call waiting so good luck trying to call ahead.  Needless to say that I will never come back here again.

zYC7_8aHhJgV844D99JDSQ.text: We ordered the BBQ wonton soup, spicy basil noodles and the egg fried rice. Thai tea was very good. My combination spicy noodles level spice were really good, not too oily and they had a lot of vegetables and meat. The egg fried rice has delicious. Added rice noodles to the BBQ wonton soup and it was enough for 2 people. Prices are very reasonable which makes this place a great value. Nice decor complete s the experience. We will come again next time we visit Las Vegas!

k_AfcZq00vxtKxm7kFz8eQ.text: Love there food here..so yummy and great prices not so expensive..fried ice cream is always a must for me here for dessert so good

BKfKCcUMCVhUOxPdBF3C7g.text: Tastes good but be careful. I ordered my food 3/10 spicy level. But it was so spicy it upset my stomach. Soups are good. And fried rices have good combination of flavors.

B0GeVxzG0OUG6GXE_69GNA.text: I've been at the number 2 and this one is better by a lot. The deco feels like expensive but everyone was so relaxed that it felt good. The Panang Avocado with salmon was ok. Im not into "gravy" kind curry but lots of avocado and chunks of salmon it was great for the price. My wife had red duck curry and it was really good with the pineapple bits. Bistro kind of place and not expensive at all.

5dA0AwM96Dwt3oGX8VbIbw.text: Called and placed my order. Was told told it would be ready in 15 minutes.  I arrived 10 mins after I called and waited 20 more mins. People came in  after me were seated and got there food. When I finally received my food and took it home it was cold. Never going here again. And not to mention the fried wonton was fried so hard I could barely eat and. And nothing was inside of them .

EcEcFAIRXxlcX0wayW6Psw.text: I love Thai food and I know it well. I ordered pineapple fried rice and it came out like Chinese fried rice with pineapple in it. No curry, cumin , or anything that resembles Thai. My niece ordered Egg drop soup , and it tasted like dish soap and was very cloudy. My daughter ordered breaded chicken ( greasy and gross) My niece ordered yellow curry and was never asked how spicy  she wanted it. I will never go back to this place. I felt like I was in the Matrix dodging bullets. If you want real Thai check out Archie's. The waitress did try to give me something else, buying lost my appetite.

dBODUXjwgy1eyY5mW2eTkg.text: Love this place I may have reviewed before but for the last year I have eaten here and it has remained just as good and affordable as day one!!! Also love how clean this place is!!!

1l5sMfYWfzOi7gwPoJuXAw.text: This is one of the only Thai places on the NW side of town, and thankfully it's very good.  Had it for the first time tonight and tried the green curry, chicken satay, chicken pad thai, tom kha soup, and mango rice.  Everything was great- it's traditional Thai comfort food.   We ordered it for pickup, it was ready on time, and the restaurant was nice and clean. They did mix up the spice levels, and made my curry very spicy when I only wanted a spice level 1.  The to-go mango rice seemed pretty small as well.  Staff was friendly.  Pin Kaow is better, but if you're in Summerlin this place will do!

WvNxLbBVs7IycbiuL_TX5g.text: My husband is Thai and we tend to eat at Thai restaurants often. This is our regular place. It's one of the closest thai places to our home and the food is good. The portions are a good size as well. We are a family of 6 so portion size is important to us. We can eat here for less than most restaurants (including several fast food choices).

A5A0xDFoJGWQgM4TLEce1w.text: I only gave three stars because they were pretty stingy with the meat. The dishes were deceiving, you wont realize how little meat it had until you start digging in. Would rather spend my money on Pin Kaow which is only a couple of blocks away.

AD7Jro6q-LuBko9aHt6_xA.text: I'm glad we tried this place. My hubby ordered BBQ pork fried rice which was sooo delicious, I had the Tom Yum which was so delicious too hot and perfect flavor.  Place was clean and we experienced great fast friendly service and the Thai tea is soo good too.  I recommend this place for lunch very affordable.

ZMP8c0H1GssrLwuYnYVsEQ.text: I was a bit hesitant to eat here just because it's such a random spot for a noodle house to be in, right next to my smith's? But good thing the bf did his research on yelp when i was craving yummy soup!  This place was packed Friday night,I didn't expect this place to look so nice, it was an actual sit in restaurant that's nicely decorated.   it's a small place but the food was GREAT! prices were great too! it was 6.95 for a bowl of Beef Stew Noodle soup and it was a pretty big bowl and couldn't even finish it! Their soup was very flavorful without being too powerful.  We also tried their Pad see ew and the Chicken Panang curry. The pad see ew was not the best but it was still pretty good, and the chicken panang was okay. I'll be back to try their other Thai dishes and Soups. DEFINITELY try their soups b/c the Soup alone earned this place the 4 stars:)   One down side, there's no restroom in this restaurant so i had to hold it.. actually 2 down sides, the table got a little crowded for me and my boyfriend but i guess that's our fault for ordering too much!   TRY it!   plus the servers were really nice.

VTy4xvybGGKA8okNSM-XLA.text: I have been here quite a few times now. Both as dine in and take out. We have also frequented the Thai Noodle House on Wynn Road, but once we found out this was the same one but in the northwest we go here all the time. The prices are very reasonable ($8 or so a dish) and the flavor is the same.   The decor at this location is much more modern and nicer than the original one in China Town i.e. this is casual date appropriate whereas the location in Chinatown would strike me more as meeting up with friends after having a few beers. Service has always been prompt and the food comes out quick. It has never been busy when we are here but I think that may just be lack of knowledge of this location. Which is good and bad, I like that it is not crowded and it is quiet but conversely I really want them to stay in business.    I have tried quite a few things, but I always circle back to the Avocado and Salmon Panang. I love that they give a lot of sauce, because I like using my rice to sop up all the sauce and there is plenty to go around. I also get the duck curry quite often, but what can I say duck is almost always good. I always get the Thom Kai (same as Thom Kha Ka - please forgive me if I am not spelling this correctly). The meat, even the chicken, is tender - often times at other places, even at my favorite Lotus of Siam, the chicken is dry, more than likely from boiling the chicken in the broth, but I haven't had that experience here.   This is a million times better than most cheap chinese places and the same cost as the prices are very reasonable. Although don't get me wrong, cheap chinese has its place in my little world too.  Not to mention they are in the same center as the German Bread Bakery - so if you time it right you could go to both and get morning pastries for the next day too!

2ylUfnOklrX4LiWI1s85xw.text: Pad thai is yummy! Also obsessed with the pineapple fried rice and the pineapple curry with shrimp! Always a go to when I'm looking for something super yummy and quick or  a last minute carry out order

RhuNB-Q6rg3-PVEVmEBmHA.text: Finally some solid thai food near the crib. Rampart and Lake Mead....In my opinion it crushes Jasmine Thai and Pin Kaow in this vicinity. A few more impressive visits will constitute some 5 star action.....UPDATE: 5th STAR earned do to continuous awesome food! The wifey and I have tried multiple dishes on their menu and have been impressed with them! Tom Ka Goong, Tom Yum Goong, Duck noodle soup and Seafood Tom Yum Noodle soup with Rice noodles are a few of our favorites. Great for kids also!

dpAmYR4X4uDGnB6bMsFM1w.text: They are always so nice and their food is delicious, good price as well. I usually order takeout but the inside of their restaurant is very cute and clean. Thanks people of Thai Noodle House for the delicious food!

1LDIf-Ohv_kxzUYTLr4tUA.text: Hit up Thai Style on the way home from taking the bus to LA - ordered up veggie egg rolls, my beloved Pad Ped Snapper, Thai Spicy Noodles and the Three Flavor Salmon - all at a 6 or so heat. The egg rolls were, again, sizzling hot and perfectly done - crispy on the outside with soft veggies on the inside.  The Noodles hit the table next - ALMOST too spicey-hot - but that really means just right. The Pad Ped was a disappointment.  A completely different preparation from the last time we had it - the breading was not thick and crunchy, but more like a light dusting of fine panko and swimming in a thin sauce (last time it was more like a paste). Don't get me wrong, this is still a great dish - just completely different from what I had experienced prior.  I had a bite of the Three Flavor Salmon - which seemed really nice and complex.

fJrkvKBim_2KhSFLmRHHpg.text: I absolutely love their soups and the pot stickers are the best ever!

BSw2vteh_Qp5rM0bHuG4sQ.text: Food was mediocre (tofu and vegetable lunch special) to good (Noodle House Tom Yum Soup Bowl), but not great. Service was poor. Despite having two waitresses asking us the same things over and over, we had to ask for water 4 times before actually getting any.

Y4ZflR7e2-ehyahaGU0vyw.text: We ordered the Sliced Beef Noodle Soup with egg noodles and Crab Fried Rice to go. Meat was a little tough but otherwise, great food! Very plentiful!

m_oaorht7O6pJaE3RrC6_A.text: This place is great. Best value of any place I've found in Vegas. Food is great, prices are extremely cheap, service has always been good in all the time I've eaten here. All around you can't go wrong.

e9CNJEHTITdkhfm7k_qJRw.text: Food is always to satisfaction, better throughout the week than on weekends. I CRAVE their soups!!! A must try, at least once.

ygn-6NZ35ZLbqWmyRc-b8Q.text: Best take out Thai food since moving to LV one year ago; best Asian food take out since arriving in LV too!

W4sqbROWRdVjZOiAD-lG0Q.text: This was my 1st time here, and the Customer and was great! There is a guy named Night, and he was awesome. Being new to Thai food He answered my questions with patience, and even made some suggestions. I ordered a Thai tea, yellow curry, and pad Thai with steamed tofu. Portions are good, and food was good. I will come back for the customer svs!

wLsM9J1BINcvuo1xWL9beA.text: Great food.. Super cheap! This is our new place to get delivery for work from now on.

AC5mQrwRIWLgGj7ZqigOQw.text: I love this place. I love that it is so very close to where I stay. The food is great and the restaurant itself is really quite charming in decor. Very rarely do I find an affordable place with more then half a dozen items on the menu that I would consider superb. From the coconut chicken soup to the pad thai and beef noodle classics to their signature and quite possibly my favorite dish here, the pad ped  snapper. Seriously, for under ten dollars you can get a warm, delicious thai delicacy, served quickly, with a smile. This place is perfect to meet up at for a quick lunch or to order take-out on the way home. Especially now that the weather is getting cooler again, I'm for sure looking forward to taking home some of their amazing soups and comforting stews.

hFDsaUvj5kbNoiLQ38kRsw.text: You cannot beat their lunch specials Monday-Sunday 11-4pm.  Two entrees, soup, appetizer for under $8.00.  I had the yummy mint chicken and spicy eggplant with eggdrop soup and fried tofu - great stuff!  They have extended their dining area and updated the decor since they first opened.  Check it out!

dlCsj63r4cv6fVD8QnYnuA.text: Great food very authentic. Duck fried rice was very good. Tom yum soup was super good.

0GED3lshtJTFe-HwCyAnXw.text: This Thai restaurant is a great value for the amount of food you receive. Food comes out fast and taste great

bCUqn7wJY08JxvbDPxwuIg.text: This place has reasonable prices. They have a large selection of food here. The Satay Chicken is very dry. It was difficult to eat. I liked the Pineapple Fried rice . I had 3 helpings of it. Their Thai Tea is pretty sweet. The Phat Thai was good too. Their Green Curry Paste Fried Rice was really spicy.

JnGOVzppVQms68Pf-VwqYw.text: We order from this place all of the time. I've had their Seafood Combo Tom Yum, the Sliced Beef Soup, the Beef Combo Soup, Fried Chicken Over Fried Rice, and now their Duck Soup. Everything is great.

Lmf8h6v3oh7-G0hi4gMH4Q.text: I really hate rating a restaurant based on service alone because the food here is good, but....  Ok this is review is a 3 Star ONLY because of the employees and the service. This is my third time coming in here and this place does serve good food!   1st visit: I ordered their BBQ Pork and Chinese Sausage combo fried rice, but they told me they ran out of Chinese Sausage. It's 11:30 and they opened at 11:00.  2nd visit: I ordered the same thing and instead they gave me BBQ Pork with Fried Rice. Not what I ordered, but it was good.   3rd time I visit and I ordered the same thing again hoping that I finally get to eat what I've been trying to order the first time. I ordered my food and 45 MINUTES LATER my food came out!!! I've NEVER waited that long for my food!  I'll give it 4 stars again. They haven't given me bad service since then.

wsAVNvmtEiCIRl-dymkU3A.text: Best duck noodle soup in the NW! Customer service is excellent and everyone is friendly. Thai tea is on point

sy0QAhD06IrvrGYANqoIag.text: Stay away from this place. The management is very rude. Gf ordered the beef noodle soup,and ask if it had a lot of vegetables in it.The waiter said yes. When we got the bill they added a dollar more to the price! All this without informing of the extra charge! And the beef was so tough she couldn't eat it! When we made the complaint to the manager she ignored us and didn't even apologize! Food is not as expected. Noodles were overcooked. The people are not customer oriented. We are not going to come back. First time here and the last!  .

3AUJTQcfzSB-lOc8SyBVPA.text: If you're in the mood for Thai this is the place. Moving here from SF I needs a great Thai restaurant and this is it!

5Dpz2QOQlchqV9eocT4z2Q.text: You get what you pay for... very bad service, average food. Thai green curry with vegetable more spicy than tasteful. $7.85 . When I walk in, I have been seat at a dirty table. Not very enjoyable waitress who forget to smile, draining her feet  and drop your plate on the table like "eat that" of course when you pay cash, there is no ticket coming back.

3HEo7DL6iPjUW5Y1mL2TGw.text: All I eat is the beef noodle soup! You have to try it! It's a large portion and it always tastes the same. A very consistent place. Most servers are friendly but there is on server that should not leave their home lol

AeuvpYKE2HS3Mx6jny0Pig.text: This was a terrible experience. I ordered to go. Pai thai, and Tom yum soup. The pai thai had no flavor the tom yum had weird imitation chicken.

q6UfOcO72ynH8-yKHxVgQg.text: So sorry people expect a smile when you walk in - Really??  It is about getting consistent food, service and inexpensive.  This is not top shelf, however it is great for consistency.  Cooks change, however the recipe are the same - KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.

4roSmZEt7E1QHNUuEVAEjw.text: Service was bad even though barley anyone was there . My boyfriend got the chicken soup and it tasted out of a can . I got some bland chicken. Wouldn't try it again.

9CEeYUlTBu2YtROBcJWT3A.text: I ordered food for my kid and they accidentally made it spicy. With no hesitation they re made my food with a smile! I highly recommend this place, super authentic as well

QRcLNJ3ZYOm-Hk3xkG_7hQ.text: This is one of my most visited Thai restaurants in Vegas for multiple reasons. The food is great for a really reasonable price. I think their Panang curry is super flavorful and that goes for vegetarian and meat added as well. I love their spicy basil leaf tofu, pineapple fried rice, and the pad thai and pad see ew -- which are pretty standard. I also really like their papaya salad + Thai beef jerky--probably the most winning items I have tried on their menu. It's got the right amount of spice and crisp on the edges, and the papaya salad compliments it well. I could go on and on because their selection is great and everything I have tried has not disappointed.   This location has a good amount of seating and is cute and spacious inside. One thing to note is that it takes a bit longer for food to come out, so not so great if you are in a rush.

qvReNP9Ht-5zcfX8gr3zCg.text: I'm mixed on this place for a few reasons, but thought to round up based on the reason of coming here: for the food.  So on a Saturday night, we were craving Thai food in the area. It seems every place needs a reservation, even a Thai restaurant. The one down the street, I could understand as it was an "upscale" version of one. This place, however, seemed to be a mom and pop place that was like any other noodle houses from the LA area I am used to. Just to be sure, I called to see if they needed reservations. The lady on the phone, who spoke non-fluent English, claim I need a reservation for 2 kids and 2 adults. I had a feeling this was yet another place pulling my leg with the "need reservations on a Saturday night." And yes, it was one of those spots that lied.  We showed up 10 minutes after I called... to an empty noodle house other than 3 tables occupied. Just as I thought: another place claiming you needed reservations. What was a bit of an insult in addition to that notion was the fact that this place has zero customer service! No hello, no smile, no glance. We stood there for close to 5 minutes until a staff finally said they would be with us. Ok...  Again, the place was rather empty at 6pm-ish on a Saturday, with the exception of hearing a grumbling waitress telling us to order quickly as they're backlogged on orders mainly due to deliveries. So now it's slowly making sense!  Anywho, why were we here--to grub!!!! I will say this: the food here is delicious enough that the non-existent customer service can be waived. We tried the pat see ew and pineapple fried rice: basic Thai food that can easily be botched due to catering to the "American" taste buds and not actual Thai. Is this actual Thai? To a point. I can tell from the seasoning that Chinese spices such as Maggi sauce seasoning and Chinese 5-spices powder were used on both of the dishes...but it made the food good! So good that the 2 adults scarfed down every piece of food on our plates. And it was not because we waited around 40 minutes after we ordered to finally eat (hey, they did give us a heads up).  Food: good Price: even better for the food! Customer Service: subpar  Overall, I would give this place another shot if I happen to be in the area. I just hope that blowing off customers own the phone claiming they need reservations when it wasn't the case does not deter you from eating at this tiny joint!

8VzQNpuSuMg7iB9BUB_h-w.text: Food was okay. But the servers are kind of rude. So I asked one of their girl servers for a glass of water with ice, she ignored me. And for the second time, I reminded her about my glass of water with ice.. She raised her voice and said, 'yes i know i know'. LOL

Qx6-jTmNJ1kbDSK4rGMzFA.text: So, I'm an idiot but I read the delivery as $15 and it's free. I'm putting it out there so other folks don't do what I did and ordered $15 or more then expected free delivery only to get charged $4 for something I could've picked up myself.  Ugh. My bad on expectation and also communicating with them when I ordered if I had made the delivery.  Just explicitly putting it out there. They don't don't do free delivery.   Food and price is decent.

vxD_1BoBDONBa-pQcCM5Bw.text: Ordered lunch special that came with rice and soup.  Egg drop soup was thick, little bland.  Entree serving was okay, but the rice they gave me was dry, like it had been sitting out for hours.  Never refilled our drinks.  My friend ordered beef noodle soup and that was good.

6po2fGu4MaT9IwWhSxHR_A.text: The food here is decent BUT the reason why I'm leaving 2 stars is because EVERY SINGLE TIME I order for delivery, the lady who takes my order does not speak good English AT ALL and there is always a communication barrier. It takes 20+ minutes to put in a simple delivery order. Insane! On top of that frustration, she gets upset with me because I make special requests (which are so simple btw) because I like my food prepared in a specific way and she seems to get overly irritated with me. Did I do something wrong by making a simple request of how I (the paying customer) likes to have my food prepared? I don't think so! She acts as if I'm difficult when in fact it's the other way around.   Here's a solution: Put someone who speaks clear English to take delivery orders.   This is EXTREMELY frustrating and the next time I visit in person I will be addressing it with the owner or manager and if they don't acknowledge this as a valid concern then you lose me as a customer forever. Not that they care but I'm making it known in case they read this review. I actually placed a delivery order today and experienced the same problem AGAIN. I will no longer be ordering from here because I get tired of dealing with people who can't speak English clearly enough to communicate effectively. Especially when I am a paying customer. If it was free I wouldn't care. But I spend $30+ every time and I get tired of the communication barrier.  Had to finally get that off my chest!

aj_m45JtsA_Gg2McIOYwXg.text: I'm surprised this place has such a high rating. Walked in and didn't feel welcomed at all. The place was dirty and there were longs strands of hair everywhere.  I should've just left when I saw that, but I proceeded to order the Pad Thai. Of course, there was hair in the bag where my food was. The noodles were dry and clumped together. The beef tasteless, under seasoned and rough. It was just nasty. I will NEVER eat here again.   I just threw the whole bag away after one bite!

BfcGaPWD97rvmkXRshWPDw.text: This is a cute little hole in the wall place. I'm personally not a huge fan of Asian food BUT their stuff is GREAT, and a good price. The inside seating area is real nice and it's a good place enjoy a good meal.

pQg7gFwonCbhsFtrYtXMAg.text: Nothing worse than being hung up on! So I have been coming here for the past 3 months and getting my lunch orders to go. I have enjoyed their food which to me has always been mediocre. But its cheap, close to work, and satisfies my Thai craving. My order today was way too spicy garnished with two long hair strands. Gross!  I called and spoke with the gal who knows me very well and has always been pleasant on the phone and when picking up my order. When I called she looked my up by telephone number and said, yes you come here all the time. Can I help you? When I told her what happened and asked if I could get a replacement order she put me on hold to talk to the kitchen and advised that they said they cannot replace it. The kitchen? Since when do they make the decision. So I asked to have the Manager call me as I can send him the photos. She hung up on me!!! Unbelievable! Being a loyal patron of this restaurant I am extremely disappointed. When I called back, it went straight to voicemail three times. Time to find a new Thai place in Summerlin.

RZ9xGSjDjIo5nytkEGforg.text: We still love coming here as our Thursday ritual after the kids are done with their activities. Mainly, it's a 2 minute drive from where we are coming from and by this point we needs-ta-eat. It's not fancy, not grimey...perfect dining setting for our party of 6. We never ever have to wait for a table here especially because of our party size so that's another reason why eating here has become our ritual. While I still love their food and price point...I will have to say we have clearly seen a slight change in their food. My husband has been ordering the spicy Thai noodle (fat noodles) the past few times in a row because he lies to think what he is getting served was just an off night. Safe to say that isn't the case. He's been griping about why he doesn't get baby corn in it. Lol. The past 2 times he's poked his fork around in disgust because he notice that the veggie-to-noodle ratio is well, damnt...I such at math. Why did I even bust the ratio word out. Hahahha. Okay seriously though, his dish looks more like a stir fried vegetable plate rather than a noodle dish with vegetables.   We ALWAYS order the Thai fried rice and I swear the past several times its either lacked in flavor and/or on the oily side!! They used to serve it all nice to us...throwing coriander leaves on there, etc...but the serving size looks like it has reduced and no more pretty garnishments. Honestly, those garnishments whether it was a part of the dish or Truely meant to be a garnish helped made the dish taste even better.   My beef soup I would order used to have fried garlic sprinkled, enough bean sprouts and baby bok choy to make me feel veggie satisfied...but again, it's like they're skimping us short. Havent had the garlic in it in awhile, sometomes i dont even think there are any bean sprouts, and the flavor has definitely lack as well. We come here weekly for the past few years so we would know for a fact if they have started to change up ways. Considering we have been coming here for a few years and only of late have we noticed a change...I wonder if they have a new cook, on a budget cut, etc...  Bummer. I loathe when that happens. Anyway, we will still be coming in until we seriously have had enough and get fed up. Even with those new gripes, I'd still recommend giving them a shot.

VykTMsMlIuNkNZby-vTkdw.text: Awesome food and super cheap with most dishes being under $7 and still very generous portions.  I've had the Pad See-eu and Khua Kai noodles and both were awesome, though not that spicy even though I asked for a Level 7 on the spiciness.  Level 7 spicy at Pan Asian just about burned my mouth off.  Still 5 stars though, will be one of my favorite lunch spots.

e7wjwTV4HgSMQbshrKkWWw.text: This best food in Las Vegas!  I am planning my day for tomorrow and deciding when I am going to fit Thai Style Noodle House into my schedule.  Best soup ever, but I am going to try something new.  No doubt it will be the highlight of my day.

rSzWFlXmDHbq92Sq29UxGw.text: Must try the Green Curry with avocado and salmon.  Excellent dish and good service.  Prices are very reasonable as well.

eyBEeN2nspR4OyXZtmqgUw.text: Just stopped in for takeout. Ordered then noticed "C" rating. Place has been in steady decline since opening. East side facing Windows have tint half scraped off as it was a year ago. And graffiti still on those windows. Sorry to say, this is the last time we patronize this place.

ZTPbE0733PczJtpRS14zuA.text: My favorite thai place in summerlin. Great service. Great price!!!

mH1RmcXWlp3uo1x9myZlWQ.text: After being seated , it took our server 10 min. to take our drink order and this happened after I flagged him down.  After my family ordered everyone except my plate came out. They kept saying " so sorry " ! My family finished eating and I still don't have my plate ! As iam asking for the check , they finally bring out my food ! " so sorry " !  Si sorry for you Noodle House 3 ! Never going back again ! Lousy service !!

KZlBM6mvVL6PLfmThUnuig.text: Ordered chicken satay, chicken pad Thai and Thai ice tea. DELISH!! Great price and nice portions!!! I had my food delivered and was very please with how fast they got here and the food was still hot!! Definitely coming back for more!

2uumaaoshFJo2ZCnBPYxug.text: My family tried this new Thai place at lake mead and Rampart, the food is excellent and the prices are great. The only bad thing about the place is the rest room is in the back of the restaurant since you have to walk outside  of the restaurant and then walk back to finish dining. But as far as the food and price is concerned it is one of the places that I would recommend. The food we ordered the taste and quality is great. This is definitely a place to go back for regular dining.

oKFcPW6JzUuELijmO2n6ww.text: We order from this place 1-2 times per week and I would eat here more often if  we could afford it. The food can be somewhat inconsistent  (maybe because we always order delivery or takeout) but its almost always great.  I love the pad thai (6), it's one of the best I've ever had, and the orange beef,   which I don't even think is on the menu, crunchy, sweet, zesty, and delicious,  remember to ask for alacarte if you want a larger portion. They remember me almost every time (no beansprouts) lol, and with their large  customer base that is quite a nice touch. They do however stop answering their phone if they get busy and stop taking delivery orders if they do answer. So if  you can't get through and its still during business hours just drive over  and go inside. The prices are great, it is one of the least  expensive Thai places we've ever seen. All in all this is our go-to Thai  place, although there are a few areas they could step it up a bit, the value  can't be beaten.

uUWO-g8oBDEnKukNBMuUkA.text: This place only opened a few months ago, we've tried a few of their dishes! I can say everything we've ordered was very good! My sons favorite is their orange chicken and rice. Hubby loves their BBQ chicken with brown rice. I love their three companions plate with sticky rice and papaya salad with a little spicy. Their larb is excellent!! We order from them regularly! Service is great and they already know us! I haven't had a chance to try their deserts and drinks yet, that's next on my list. :)

eykdRadtC4AbdsCa9ymqnA.text: So good! The Tum Yum Soup with chicken ordered with mild spice is absolutely delicious! This restaurant has excellent orange chicken, chicken satay, fried rice, and most of all, the mango with sticky rice. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

hCdqmhRHP8SXH1xUVf--og.text: Never had this type of food before, I loved it but the problem is service bad, not friendly at all. We were treated like we didnt belong there or an inconvenience. That's the only reason I give them 3 stars, the food's great.

HNWWGyhXCUOaNz8Byk8lQg.text: I really don't know how this restaurant got a 4-star overall rating - this is some of the worst Thai food I have ever had. I've lived in Thailand and have had Thai food all over the world, and hands down this is some of the worst. The shrimp in our tom yum tasted spoiled (super   mushy, crumbled in my mouth - I had to spit it out). The seafood fried rice lacked flavor, and the chicken pad kaprow was dry. The only thing that was decent was the Thai iced tea. The inexpensive prices at this restaurant aren't worth it - there are plenty of other better places in Vegas.

bByczYirAowIUna8IAyBBQ.text: I ordered a Thai beef salad to go that had good spice and balenced flavor but the beef was cut very thin and somewhat dry and the salad was a little lacking as well.  Prices were good and I will give it another chance sometime soon.

1uMC7DDEYfvlFWgNcBw3Aw.text: Simply the best Thai restaurant in Summerlin and possibly in town! Great prices, fast service and delicious food.

lS0SEwDMkfm6ZPPmrNblUw.text: Clean. Fast and friendly service. The panang avocado with shrimp was delicious!  Will dine here again.

CgxM6jh8YVTI8ipholG9pg.text: When we showed up they only had a table for 2 left, it was packed, but with only 12 tables you blink and it's a waiting list.  It might be tiny on size but the dishes had alot and were very good.  I had the chicken pad thai and the bbq chicken over rice, they both were very good.  One per son waiting on the entire place but it semed to work.  Going back for the soup next time-bowls were huge!!

XEJ-pgoO0ZMUMmWl-tU9UQ.text: Thai Style Noodle House in Summerlin is amazing, really. My friends and I have been going there at least once a week (sometimes as many as 3 times a week) and every item we have ordered has been fresh, full of rich and varied flavors, and simply addictive! Should mention we all eat Paleo most of the time and there is lots on this menu for Paleo or gluten free eaters.   All the curries are great, our favorite remains the avocado/salmon (or shrimp) which we get them to add broccoli to as we require lots of vegetable intake. Also recommend the Chicken Satay, Ginger Snapper and do not miss the Pineapple Fried Rice which has such a special flavor. I have never been a fan of eggplant but do not miss the eggplant on this menu, it will blow you away!   The prices simply cannot be beat. This is high quality cuisine at a truly reasonable price.   As for the spot itself, could use some better lighting, it is just exceptionally bright. The tables are clean, the chairs really comfortable, and staff is always friendly and really knows the menu. You have to go outside to get to the bathroom around back but it is very clean. If you order take out be very careful in transport as some items are too much liquid for their take out boxes.   Love it!

pvKhJlNTMOPMxMbD2Pl8hg.text: The food was great. The problem was service. It took forever for someone to come and get our drink order. Then we finally got to order our food and it took a long time for the food to get to us. We ordered 3 entrees and 2 showed up, with the 3rd finally coming to the table 10 minutes after the first 2. An older couple asked the waiter how much longer for their food, because the wait time was too long and they were told soon. After another 10 minutes, they got up and left. A younger couple waited patiently for about 30 minutes for their food and when it still wasn't ready, told the staff that the wait time was inexcusable and then they also walked out. I might try the delivery service the next time we want to eat here, but I will probably not sit in ever again.

DHxaTfX7JZwUK3zjYIZJzg.text: Good soup, if I am stranded in summerlin I know exactly where to go if I want a Thai version of Pho.

DZBez474dLxHFu79BC6ATQ.text: This place was horrible, their service was terrible, and the food was ok. No napkins were given when the food was served and I had to ask for a refill. When waiting for the check I had get up and find a server who was sitting down eating their lunch at the same time. No kind of condiments were made available while I ate making this experience an unpleasant one. I will NOT return for seconds!

pBmTyS9gpQ-4iYkb1ig-lQ.text: I love this place.   It's close by and prices are extremely reasonable! Some of their dishes are as close to authentic Thai food as I can get in this town. The staff is Thai and they service is fast and friendly.   The food is yummy and great quality. I'm always weird about getting chicken at asian restaurants so I usually get beef. I feel like here, they are using only the breast so I get great chicken pieces in my dish. I grew up with chickens and sometimes, they were dinner so I'm picky and would only eat the breast if I had a choice.   Portions are big! Big enough for me to make two meals out of. My boyfriend and I never spend over $20-26 here. This place never disappoints us! My favorite three dishes here are the Rad Nah, Pad Se Ew, Pad Thai. Mmm...

i1YEObiUp9stnjztOdHWIw.text: Great food, great service I recommend the yellow curry and Kung Pao Chicken at Spicy level 8. Great taste!

a1lJ9dEoxp6MgpNg5LoJtg.text: I had the lunch combo. Ginger chicken, wontons and rice. Good neighborhood restaurant.

Ta6zk-ZrY4kFsqm1uRsKKw.text: This place is pretty close to my home and so good! My husband and I always get the chicken yellow curry with with the pot sticker appetizer or the crab rangoon app to go and it's all very tasty. You can't beat the price either!

bJPKn42D4Q7KzYBaZFiH3A.text: Love the tom yum soup with shrimp and pad tai shrimp as well  Enjoyable service.   Started playing football games on the tv

2RZtYevZyrg9X506cIQFyA.text: Ok Thai food. First the place looks nice, design of the restaurant is modern and comfortable. The servers are average, nothing outstanding nor poor. They seem like they just want to get people in and out, I guess there's nothing wrong with that.  Tried the chicken Satay. Nothing special, just chicken breast on sticks. No real flavor profile. The crab fried rice was salty. The Tom yum noodle was pretty good; nicely sour with just the right amount of spicy. The fried chicken was overdone; therefore a bit dry. The Thai ice tea was very good. Most places is too sweet; it was perfect here. Thus earning three rather than two stars.

e_wd7DqnFZGDUZ3U2QN6LQ.text: I think the original location is waaaay better. Had a decent selection during lunch time: beef pad see eew, combination beef noodle soup and spicy basil eggplant with tofu. My family and I originally went for the soup. I'm glad we got the two other dishes cause the soup was very lacking in flavor. The meat was dry and not tender. Pretty disappointed cause I had been craving Thai noodle soup for weeks. Service was alright, nothing real good and nothing real bad about it.

s-P9m4KbjaadD9TE_MOmLg.text: I love pad Thai so we went looking for a new place as I love eating at different restaurants. We stumbled upon this little family owned place off of lake mead and rampart - thanks to Yelp. They get a 10 for value price. Most plates start at $6.95 and average at about $8.00.  Good food quality and presentation I give a solid 9. I had the combination pad Thai and we shared a yummy serving of chicken red curry. My daughter had the Mongolian beef. All plates came extremely hot and fresh. Just the way I love it. Simply but clean presentation. Definitely one of my top 10 places to eat great Thai food.

Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pad Thai - spicey #8

DHRYxK5wc9Q4hfZRxtYaOA.text: Very solid 3 stars for me. Ordered the Penang curry which was very tasty and perfectly seasoned. The pad Thai was kind of on the sweet side for me. The pineapple fried rice was just whatever, it wasn't like OMG or anything. Kind of plain, IMHO. I would come back for the Penang curry though!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1FR-TYVcowB_DKnpXFBMww.text: I don't think that it quite lived up to the hype...might have been because I ordered take-out or ordered the wrong thing? I got the Drunken Noodles and it was incredibly greasy...It also tasted a bit bland...Also wasn't the most authentic. Maybe their noodle soups are better? I do have to say that it is very affordable, though.

gN8JH5B3xQhvcwp7DF2Aiw.text: I work at the Mountain View hospital, and I am so glad I discovered Thai Style Noodle House.  I order lunch from Thai Style Noodle House probably once a week. They are as reasonably priced as any other lunch establishment and I have yet to be disappointed by the food they deliver.   I can honestly say that their pot stickers with their special sauce on top are the BEST I HAVE EVER HAD. I also usually get either the chicken pad thai or the yellow curry. Both are always pretty good, I wish however they would provide me with a larger container for my curry. They fill the container to the rim with the delicious curry leaving me no room at all for my rice. I always end up using my own bowl to make due.  On two occasions they did have a delivery driver available. I ended up going to pick up the food and felt so much better knowing my food was coming from a really clean place.   Thai Style Noodle House is a perfect spot for some tasty Thai food.

PaITSIv8mr6QzlR8ZY3aGg.text: I love it here , the food that is. The service is a bit eh. Every time I come there seems to be an issue. The only reason I come back is for the food. I'm giving them a 3.5. Amazing food but not the best Service. I have witnessed gossip , no service due to staff eating , confused about my dietary restricting. Their pad see ew is my favorite, their broccoli is so fresh!
