cEo_aPsc2aDX04VhFPw1Sw.text: Add this restaurant to the list of Vegas Yelpers gone wrong.  I understand that Las Vegas isn't exactly a foodie destination (outside of several restaurants on and around the strip).  Thai Style Noodle House is no exception.  My party had the following: Mongolian beef, beef and broccoli, spicy string beans and pork, crispy noodles with seafood gravy.  Sweet, sweet, sweet, with a bit of MSG.  White seats with faux (?) leather all look dirty and our table top was sticky.  One star for the price as this is considered to be cheap Asian food.    My advice: Head over to Nattaya's Secret Kitchen across the street.  You'll pay more but you'll get much better food.

pAm5txHQXEqEvJa5XVfuQA.text: Great little place for some good Thai food!  Located on N. Rampart in the Smith's shopping center, Thai Style is located on a near corner of a lot.  Go slow or you might miss it because the place is tiny.  Really, there might be just over a dozen tables available for dining in.  But that's ok because Thai Style has no problems with doing take-out for you.  If you do dine in though don't worry, the place is nicely appointed!  New tables, chairs, paint.  Good ambiance, especially when it's quiet.  I hear during lunch is when the crowd is probably the biggest.  Came here with the wifey for a quiet dinner one night after we heard their second location opened up here near our side of town.  Really felt like the place was our own, there were only two other tables taken nearby, and on the counter was multiple orders ready for pickup.  The menu at Thai Style is fairly authentic feeling, with some dishes looking like they may have got a bit of an American touch.  We stuck with what we were hoping was simple and basic, but had a lot of flavor.  I love noodles, but really wasn't feeling Pad Thai.  We instead opted for the Pad See-Eu - stir-fried thick flat rice noodles (almost like chow fun) with egg and Chinese broccoli, all in a sweet dark soy sauce.  This was delicious.  The rice noodles with the sweet soy sauce was heavenly, and was given good texture with the addition of the Chinese broccoli.  It makes perfect leftovers, great midnight snack in front of the TV while watching Breaking Bad reruns!  We also had the Fried Chicken over Fried Rice - marinated, fried chicken breasts over a bed of Thai Jasmine fried rice.  This was good as well.  I would have liked the chicken to be a bit more flavorful, and a bit of a thicker piece.  However, it was yummy with the Thai fried rice which had egg, garlic, onion, salt, and pepper.  The rice was seasoned easily but just right.  And the portion was huge, more than enough for two people to share.  We got out of Thai Style with full bellies and some leftover change.  The bill was not bad at all, our total for two entrees, tax, and tip was under $19.  That was a plus!  We will be back to try other dishes, I really am interested in their red and yellow curries.  Thai Style runs some amazing lunch specials too, for short of $7 you can get a choice of TWO (yep, two) entree options from a pretty big list, and each lunch special comes with soup, rice, and an egg roll.  Don't want two entrees?  Do just one, and pay less than $6!  Dealio.

rlSp8RTmpYcCe03VMEA0qQ.text: I will say that it is a good value. You get large portions for a little money. The quality isn't bad,and flavor is okay too.  However,.... there is also, nothing spectacular, and nothing amazing that I experienced. We ordered via phone for delivery,  delivery time was estimated at an hour and a half, so decided to pick it up instead.  Ordered: the Fried Snapper, didn't specify the "whole fried snapper". oops...... the version we got was still tasty. Ordered the basil fried rice, the duck fried rice, beef salad and the chicken pad see eu. The total bill was 41.00 and it was a lot of food. The basil fried rice was good.The flavor was there, but I ordered spicy 6 and it wasn't quite spicy enough for me. I am used to Pan Asia spice..... The Beef Salad was not at all to my liking. My husband liked it, but the flavors simply didn't jive at all.... a bitter kind of taste I thought.  The Pad See Eu was bland.....The spicy levels are low here, so don't be afraid to order high! If I order here again I will order 8 or 9 spice level. Also, I didn't order any curry..... It is hard to give a True and accurate review of a thai restaurant and you don't review any curry!?!?!?!

x6jP26bbC6raYdxIPjwldw.text: Can't get anyone on the phone to place a pick-up order. Doesn't matter how good the food is if you can't buy it!

s8eigNd18TKe7sddKjPOIw.text: The first time we went here, we ate in and had a great meal, and I gave it 4 stars.  We were so happy after that first visit that we returned and took along another couple - who may be moving to our fair city - to introduce them to life as locals.  Our experience was less than stellar.  But I didn't update my review then.  On the second visit, I ordered the same salmon dish I had the first time, and it was so bad I had to send it back.  The waitress tried to explain that they use frozen salmon, and yada, yada.  Its replacement was just ordinary.  The other couple were split 50-50 in their opinions of their dishes.  During our first visit we wanted to get more information about take-out, figuring that we'd be doing that on a regular basis.  We particularly wanted to know about the soup.  Our Tom Kha was fabulous, and it was such a big bowl that we couldn't imagine we'd get that much if we had it as take-out, but the waitress assured us it was a very big container.  So on this uncharacteristically rainy night, we opted for take-out from Noodle House.  My first disappointment was taking an ordinary Chinese restaurant-type plastic container out of the bag that was only three-quarters full.  It turned out not to matter:  the soup was so unbearably spicy that we couldn't finish it.  It also had half the amount of chicken that our dine-in portion had.    Four vegetable spring rolls were decent, but very greasy.    We ordered our main dish, Pad Thai, as a chicken-beef-shrimp combination.  It had a "generous" helping of two rather small shrimp, chewy and flavorless beef, and some tender chicken.  This dish is usually very bland at other Thai restaurants, but this one was very spicy.  I didn't mind that, since it didn't cause smoke to come out of my ears like the soup did.  But the noodles were rubbery, and if it had chopped peanuts, there weren't enough to taste them.  A disappointment.  I guess it was too good to be True, but we'll go back to the other Thai restaurants we used to go to before our hopes were raised by the opening of Thai-Style Noodle House, which is so much closer to our home.  Those hopes sadly have been dashed.

fOpaTBcWXRceuHSJwPgwow.text: Ordered delivery around lunch on Sunday. I love Thai and when I dine in I go to Nittayas secret kitchen and lotus of Siam, and everything I can in Chinatown. I live in summerlin and was looking for a go to delivery.  Horrible. Had such a craving for vegetable spring rolls and I bit into the first one and it was so salty I had to spit it out. Like ocean water! I tried another thinking it may have been accidentally dropped in salt but they were all inedible. Beef jerky? So salty. Pumpkin curry? So salty. Horrible. Threw it all out :(

AoNrBoc2k-K4UqA8BIHUxg.text: I'm picky and this place past the test. My favorite is steamed tofu curry. The staff is friendly, professional and patient when I cannot decide what to order.

TYbZk2K7B4muoUeQrIUm_g.text: There are no shortage of Thai restaurants in town. This is a takeout place near my house and I must admit my expectations were low. I was wrong on so many levels. The food here is outstanding! Not 'oversauced' or greasy. I was with a large group so I had the opportunity to try a bunch of different items and everything was flavorful, fresh and amazing.

My chicken satay was so salty I could not eat it, so I took the peanut sauce from the satay and put it on my pad thai and that made it palatable.  The cucumber salad had no dressing on it, the dressing came in a little cup, but it was viscous and not mixed very well.  Dipping the cucumber into it was like dipping it in sludge. pKFs-R0CR4P1Ahuy9x-t4Q.text: Just went yesterday and the food was pretty good. However the ambiance wasn't very welcoming and the service wasn't very good. Iw1S67XzNxViB_DKHQ7qFQ.text: I'm a fan of their "Pick Two" lunch option for $7 and change, and this location doesn't try to hide the lunch specials from you! Your options are extensive and include all of their curries, unlike some Thai spots that really limit what they offer on lunch special. It comes with soup, rice and a fried treat, and the two picks are served in a nice sized dish. I think flavor-wise they are really consistent with the original location, and this location is definitely up the scale on the fancy factor- white chairs, tile on the wall, was that a chandelier? Although, it is odd you have to go outside to go to the bathroom.  I selected the mint chicken and green curry for my two. The chicken is minced, and the flavor was nice, but I probably wouldn't order it again. I realized I am out of Thai Style practice because I didn't remember the green curry coming with a mountain of bamboo shoots. I am not a fan of bamboo shoots, but the curry still had a fabulous flavor. Next time, I have to remember to order it with vegetables, hold the shoots. And, next time, maybe I will go double curry.

gf15lh9AckDons3cqTSv4Q.text: I've been twice. Once for take out, and once dining in with my Mom. My take out experience was far better than my dining in. Really poor customer service while dining in. Had to ask for simple things like napkins because they were never given.  I had their spicy Thai noodles and a Thai tea both times. The level of spiciness was very inconsistent. I got a 6 the first time and barely made it through the dish. Got a 6 the second time and tasted little to no heat.  My Mom had the BBQ pork which she thought was dry. She kept putting the broth from the soup on it to make it semi palatable.  Fried calamari appetizer was the best part of the meal. Given it's close vicinity to my house, I'll probably only return if I'm really dying for some drunken noodles.

gENd-BayCUdDE_igLwUeTg.text: This is my go-to spot for good, authentic, and cheap Thai food, not to mention their portions are huge! I come here to order to-go and whenever my friends are in town. 5 stars for quality and for the bang for your buck! The staff is friendly, although quiet.  I always end up ordering the Tom Yum Noodle Soup with 7 spice level. It is so delicious and filling. I love how this dish comes with pork, shrimp, and fish cakes. It is like heaven in a bowl and great for cold days and hangovers (hah). Their basil fried rice and thai fried rice was amazing! I can't usually eat that many carbs in one sitting but I nearly ate the whole plate in one sitting. Like I said, each plate can yield about 2 meals (3 if you are a very light eater), so order accordingly. But hey, leftovers is never a bad thing either!

It was a decent portion for only $1.25. I recommend giving this Thai restaurant a try! They have two other locations as well but I haven't been to either one yet.

W4a6zrS629tDEdLjqVutPw.text: I finally made it to this newer location and the first thing I noticed was the very small size of the restaurant. It's probably less than half the size of the one in the SW. That's not a bad thing cuz size doesn't matter...just as long as you can work with what you got. The decor is actually very stunning. It was decorated with all my fave elements: glass mosaic tile, high back chairs with button tufting, and a beautiful chandelier. It was an aesthetic, pleasant surprise to see a mom and pop establishment so nicely decorated.  Anyhow, I've been craving some noodles and I went with the intention of ordering the Thai beef noodle soup. From what I can remember, Thai noodle soup has a much better flavor than pho IMO. As I was looking at the different noodle soups I noticed one called Pork and Fish Ball noodle soup. Man, I am so glad I went with his one--this bowl of soup was absolutely delightful. You get your choice of four different types of noodles, i went with the flat rice noodles for my bowl. It contains pork, ground pork, and fish balls in a chicken broth. It is garnished with fried garlic, which is the one ingredient that pulls all these great flavors together so well. The broth had a nice clean taste to it with a hint of white pepper. It looks pretty simple but the flavors are so good, I didn't wanna mess with it by adding anything to it. I left it unembellished and ate it all as it came. This is one of the few noodle soup dishes that I didn't feel the need to doctor up with hoison or sriracha.  The ingredients in this soup was reminiscent of what comes in my fave noodle soup dish called Phnom Penh noodles. The Vietnamese make a version of this soup and they call it hue tieu Nam Vang but I have not been able to find a worthy substitute for my PP noodles until now.   Great prices, great noodle dishes and friendly service. So glad this 3rd location opened up so I don't have to go to Chinatown or the SW for some awesome noodle soup.

kU0fdvJNN0oGou3NVZks7Q.text: Thai Style Noodle House...what I like to think of as the fast food of Thai food. I ordered the fried chicken, duck fried rice, pad see-ew and yellow chicken curry (all at level 5 spice which was perfect for me and I love spicy food). I've also prided the Thai with having such flavorful, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside, chicken. This fried chicken lacked the flavor packed wings and drumsticks I'm used to. However, it was fried to perfection! The duck fried rice was good and the duck taste was there, but they are a little stingy on the duck meat. They also add pineapples, which I'm not too fond of IN my food so I picked it out.  The pad see-ew, which I explain as the Thai version of Chinese chow fun, is always good whenever I get it. I got it with beef and it's cooked with eggs and a leafy vegetable (can't really tell what kind it is). The yellow chicken curry was honestly nothing special and tasted like any other curry I've had. That said, it was still good.  I must say though, they are not stingy with their portions and the prices are actually more decent than I remember it being. For all of the food mentioned above, plus an order of wonton soup, my total came out to $38.60. If you're looking to find a quick fix to your Thai food craving, Thai Style Noodle House is a good place to go as they seem pretty authentic for a "fast food" style Thai restaurant.

sbfNmz43jpbtRjhZE15-bQ.text: This is my to go place whenever I crave Thai food. Especially the Panang Curry, the spices and coconut based sauced is seasoned just right and pairs well with rice. Another dish I enjoy is the Pad See Ew, flat rice noodle with a soy sauce based flavor and Chinese broccoli and the option of protein or tofu. A great option from the popular Pad Thai that most people are accustomed to.  My only complaint I have is the customer service. At times the service is great and other times it's been lacking. A few times we have been ignored or the order is wrong. The management needs to take the initiative to communicate the entire staff on how to handle customer service. I have a few friends and neighbors complained that the posted time doesn't correlate to the actual operating hours. I still remember we were turn down at 9:28pm and the posted time was 10:00pm. The staff member on duty told us that the kitchen is closed. This is very misleading to the public and doesn't reflect a professional business practice. I recommend that you call ahead if you plan to arrive later in the evening. Overall, delicious Thai food at a reasonable price point!  2017 Yelp Review #84

vmRCWkHtQN4vflSWNHg5Og.text: Delicious thai food but the original one on Spring Mountain in Chinatown is better. The go-to order is always:  - Red Duck Curry - spicy (THE BEST!!) - Pad See Ew with beef- spicy  These two dishes, the red duck curry especially, haven't been done better anywhere else. The red duck curry has huge chunks of duck in a creamy red curry broth with generous pieces of pineapple. Affordable, delicious, and one of my staples when I'm craving thai food.

tQOeX9pMOUCcQ85ZNztoTg.text: Thai noodle house is a great go to for lunch and dinner. The best Tom Kah coconut soup. Very good Pad Si Ew.. They stay very consistent. We have a little issue with the partially peeled window tint and graffiti on the east window. Not sure why it remains over last 4 years. This is why we rate this 3 stars. Food deserves 4 stars on average, and can be higher.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This pic shows peeled window tinting and some graffiti. Has been there for 5 years. Not sure why it remains.
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lBZIRfiPo4oQvjf9qmjTIw.text: I love this restaurant and was surprised that they had one on this side of town. Came here for lunch with some friends and it does not disappoint despite the difference in location.   I love how cheap the food is and everything was great. I went with what I usually get which is the S9 3 companion chicken with papaya salad and sticky rice. It was close to the price of lunch which is still great.   One of my friends ordered this crispy noodle dish which was really good. She's a regular so they also brought out extra noodles for her because she likes to take it home and make another meal out of it. For the price of it and making it into two meals I thought it was great. Next time I will come back for lunch and try a different dish.   Overall, the ambience is the same as the other locations. Nice and Asian feel to it. The bathrooms were clean and the service was great. I definitely will be coming back in the future.

MUi5nG-C3zS43n5HeXt1mw.text: Love this local gem.  The food is always consistent and the service is always quick. The interior design throws you off a little but make no mistake, with all the Thai competition in town, this one holds its own. Here is the breakdown of a few staples: Thai Noodle House Pot Stickers, Duck Fried Rice, Spicy Basil Leaf Fried Rice, Yellow Chicken Curry, Pad Thai with Shrimp, Garlic and Pepper Chicken (my favorite), and the Spicy String Beans with Ground Pork.  My mouth is watering just thinking about this place!  Make sure to order spice level 3 if you are not a big fan of spice, it is just enough for the flavor but not overly spicy!  If you live in the area, or just passing by, make sure to give them a shot. It's local flavors like this that make neighborhoods great!

vuzcQEErP7xr9cc7gF9SQg.text: One of my fam's favorite Thai restaurants in Vegas. Their food is very authentic and contains awesome flavors. They have several locations as well. Their main one is in the Chinatown area on Spring Mountain.  I looove spicy food so I'm always up for trying places that specialize in spicy dishes. Thai and Laotian foods are known to have a lot of heat, and if you're like me, this place would be a yummy choice!  Pro-tip: -Some orders may be served in A La Carte portions, so make sure to ask for this if you plan on sharing dishes with a group! v6_MY83itRMQeKymEqmuvw.text: The Thai style noodle house is one of our go to dinner options for takeout. There's some really good Thai places Here in Summerlin but this restaurant consistently impresses not only with flavor but their consistency and flavor from order to order. They have several things on the menu we stick to the Thai and everything right down to simple pad Thai is very good.

qA3bSTD4G-KUV5s0WkzdhA.text: Thai Style Noodle House has tasty Thai food for a great value. The prices are low and you get  sharable sized portions.   I started off with the Appetizer combo which was about $7.95. It had Chicken Satay , Crispy Shrimp , one  Egg Roll, Crab Rangoon, Wontons, and  a tiny cucumber salad. It also came with dipping sauces (sweet and sour and peanut butter ). If I had to pick one thing off the platter the Crispy Shrimp would be my favorite . It is shrimp wrapped in a egg roll wrapper then deep fried.   I ordered the BBQ & Chinese pork Fried Rice  for $6.95. This was plenty to split and also take some home for lunch the following day. The rice was delicious it wasn't soggy and had fresh veggies in it. I've seen some places that put frozen vegetables in their rice which is a total turn off.   The service was great we had our drinks filled constantly which is important when eating spicy foods. Thai Style Noodle House is a chain so there is more than one you can go to in the Las Vegas Valley.

78jP0ewod-maNj9xhJHv0A.text: This place is a joke. I come here often and do big togo orders. Last night, It wasnt busy at all, 2 table dining in and a couple togo orders. After i had finished ordering(10items) i had asked them i needed extra hotsauce and the guy had told me okay. The bill came out to $82 and was told about 20-25min wait, which was fine. Ive been waiting outside for 25min and had went inside and was told 10more min. So i went back out and waited. Went to ask and was told another 10min. So by now i was getting a little frustrated because its already been 45min since ive been waiting. Then i asked and was told 1 last item was being made. So i patiently waited without complaining because by this time i was very annoyed. After the food had come out, i asked for some extra hotsauce. The guy tells me, he put 3 hotsauce in the bag. I asked him could i get some more, and he tells me, "we charge 5 for $1". I told him, excuse me, i just waited almost an hour for my food and not even a single apology for the food being late or anything and has the nerves to tell me he charges for hotsauce,? Mind you, i ordered 10 dishes and he put 3 hotsauce in my bag. And this guy is talking to me like 3 is plenty for the amount of food i ordered. You do understand that i just ordered 10 dishes, paid $82dollars and waited for an hour when i was told it would be ready in 20-25min, and not even a single apology, then tries to charge me for hotsauce? You kidding me? The least you can do is give me 1 hotsauce per 1 item, if not more when asking for extra but gives me 3 and tells me i need to pay? Then they start talking in chinese of whatever they are and shoves hotsauce in my bag of food. You people are a joke. Learn how to treat customers. No wonder this place is always empty. Just lost a customer and more, because ill make sure none of my friends and families ever come to this place ever again.

zBSBG3aY_3IN5uZksyzoGg.text: So I tried the Won-ton Soup ($6.75) and it was unique. It had a unusual fishy flavor and was notably spicy. I ordered the soup in hopes it would sooth my sore throat, but instead it gave me an unexpected punch of spicy and fishy. It was not necessary the flavor I was hoping I would get.   I have determined my favorite item on this menu is the #38 - Khua-Kai Rice Noodle ($7.25). This dish consists of wide rice noodles wok-fried with chicken breast, egg, and bean sprouts. I prefer to substitute the chicken for fried tofu. Any time I come to this restaurant I order a #38 and the N.H. Style Pot Stickers.   ----------------------------------------  Order your food ahead of time if you want to take it home because you do have a short wait time. The food is pretty amazing. They have really good Pad Thai here! Their N.H. Style Pot Stickers  are $5.75 and totally worth it. Will absolutely return again!

ncbrzYb7yblf-NYBmkysrg.text: Great food and prices.   Willing to accommodate my vegan diet.   Great service and portions are very generous.   On the spice level, five is too hot. Stay at number three.  Added bonus if you belong to the American Airlines advantage dining program. You get miles for your dollars spent here.   Will definitely come back and recommend.

r42VZwOZqaU5hHEGwcO2MA.text: I ordered the chicken red curry with a 5 spice, and the beef pad see ew also with a 5 spice and both dishes were absolutely delicious! I've been to many Thai restaurants in town, and this was definitely one of the best! I ordered it for delivery to work and they arrived a little before the promised time. KFKH1fLxAFtfvoHJjtE5QA.text: Mmm, Thai food.  We have a casual dating-kind of relationship going.  I can go for awhile without it, then all of a sudden have a craving that simply can't be fulfilled.  By no means am I married to one Thai place, but my favorite is still probably the one by my house.  Don't be confused, though - I still enjoy this place every now and again.  We've spent some pretty good time together.  I've actually eaten here a few times but usually I get delivery to my job.  The pad see ew is absolutely delicious - the flat noodles are nice and well-cooked, tossed with a delicious sauce, chicken and plenty of vegetables (but not too many that you feel like you're getting stiffed).  The red curry I had when I was super-congested - I believe I ordered a 5 or a 6 (their spicy scale is 1-10) - and not only was it, too, tasty, but it also allowed me to breathe with its well-placed spiciness.  The pad thai is good and reminiscent of the pad se ew but I felt it lacked a little flavor as I really enjoy that in-your-face peanut sauce that, to me, is a staple of the pad thai dish.  It had a hint of a lemon flavor, which is the biggest reason I dislike the pad thai from Le Thai, but it wasn't enough to completely turn me off to the dish.  Or maybe I was starving that day.  I don't know, but it was gone pretty fast.  Each time there's certainly been enough for two meals (I just happened to really be hungry on the pad thai day) and the prices are quite reasonable.  Delivery time can vary - once I waited almost an hour while another time it was around 20 minutes.  Give it a first date - you may end up going for a second.  =)

_GYFeXJcWh3hHJk_M7rXCg.text: Super Authentic noodle soup. We went there on the off chance as we just moved here and dint really know whats good. This place was awesome. Satay was moist and tasty. The Mrs got the combo beef soup and i got the thai noodle combo.  They were both packed with flavor. Noodles were good if not slightly overcooked but all in sll it reminded me of being in Bangkok. Try it!

They still are very rude about it on the phone. I had a lady say 3 times that it would be a wait, and I said each time it was fine.  She then proceeded to sigh into the phone like she was pissed. vHHK7pICd1UHEK2eF0vdlA.text: This is my new favorite Thai place. It is so good and tasty the Thai tea is amazing and a huge size. The employees are so nice and the food is just out standing my favorite dishes are the pad Thai and pineapple fried rice.

oVnd5YEteBEwlSkuLRhoJQ.text: I used to love this place and have no complaints I actually felt the need to change my 5-star review. This was my families go to Thai restaurant but tonight was a completely different story. We ordered our usual which was pad Thai, pad se ew, spicy eggplant, and my dads soup. Our pad Thai came out and it literally looked sloppy and was the smallest amount I thought it might've been a joke. I literally had to ask the waitress for another order because that fed no one, I even mentioned it to the waitress "can I please order another because this was unusually tiny"  They brought out another yet charged me for both when one of them clearly wasn't even a full order. It's unfortunate because we were regulars here but honestly the way they handled the situation put a bad taste in all of our mouths. Time to find a new Thai restaurant!

NWyhbCyPhXYinTfNgLqwXA.text: Don't come for dinner, just come for the lunch specials.  The quantity is the same.  Usually places give larger quantities for dinner, but this place gives the same so why pay more for the same thing.    As for the food, it's decent, but I wouldn't say it's the best.  I prefer the flavor at archis Thai.  The duck curry had slivers of duck meat, not a lot, and they give more rice than food.  The pad Thai was decent.  Just average Thai food, if you need a quick lunch fix, it's a place to get some quick Thai food.

XXXjAHUZCe1XlgXTn_0z2w.text: The yellow curry was bomb!!! The mango sticky rice was a nice dessert. Seriously, I'd recommend this place for some good food at a really good price.

Dx38INVyzoLEVmrPZBKCQQ.text: When you're hungry, just got into town and want some Thai Tea, this is a good place to stop.  Came here with my Aunt and Uncle who frequent this place as it is close to their home.    The place is clean and the AC is ice cold!  The food we ordered came out quickly and was delicious.  The squid salad was spicy but very fresh.  The Pad Thai Noodles was yummy and the soup was on point.  Don't ask me why we ordered soup when it was 115 degrees out... lol   Prices are reasonable, service is excellent.  I will not hesitate to drop by here when in town again.  I like their style... see what I did here!?

3PvHYQoktRMaldXy6HpaJA.text: Best Thai in Vegas. The red curry with beef is very good. I get the spice level at 9 and it's perfect. Just enough heat to let you know it's there. Full of carrots and beef and pepper it's so good. My wife says their pad Thai is the best she's ever had. She gets it with shrimp and mild spice level 2 and it's really tasty.  I've tried it and agree it's yummy. I tried the shrimp rolls and they were delicious. It's just a shrimp wrapped in egg roll wrapper and dried. Served with a sweet sauce they were really good!

CvY4lKiYZIWw1o7f_sszJA.text: No frills Thai restaurant. Very cheap prices and decent portions. We got 2 entrees and an app for $22. Nice! Keep in mind that Thai spicy is very spicy. I can eat a normal amount of spice, and said to keep my yum woon sen salad mild. It was borderline too hot for me, but it was so yummy, tangy and fresh I powered through. The salad is about $7, so you get ground chicken and two small shrimp. Don't expect huge chunks of chicken breast and large prawns.  Also enjoyed the fried calamari, but it is the calamari steaks cross cut (which curl when cooked) and then deep fried without batter. It's a little more tough than your battered Italian calamari rings. I'll most likely skip this next time.  Plus is it's located across the street from Savers, so if you have time after lunch, do a little thrifting!

Jwv2X0uZTYzAZ6ydMD-3xg.text: It was my first time coming here and I was extremely disappointed.  Although the employees were friendly, they rip you off on food. I ordered the thai spicy basil rice with crab and let me tell you, there was NO crab. When I brought it to their attention,  it was huge debate with customers and employees which I thought was very unprofessional. One of the employees looks at my food and even said it was wrong and there was no crab. The chef came out and said he did put crab but not a lot. 3 other customers looked and saw NO crab and they would not fix my order. Their customer service was terrible to say the least. I definitely got a refund. Then my shrimp and chicken glass noodles only had 2 tiny pieces of shrimp. I will not be ordering from here again and I definitely don't recommend ordering seafood from them as well.

0fq5jbWlsnM2E8KUetF3JA.text: Thai Noodle House is easily my favorite Thai food in Vegas, especially since my second choice closed down recently. The boo and I recently ordered take out from this location using UberEats. Our food actually arrived quicker than the quoted time which was nice surprise.   We ordered the crab rangoons to share. They were perfectly cooked, crispy and did not skimp on the cream cheese filling. I also thought the portion size was pretty big for the price. (5/5) For an entree I had the Shrimp Pad Thai. I do wish they gave tofu as a meat option as well, but nonetheless the shrimp was delicious. I had mine at a 7 spicy, which I didn't think was too overly spicy at all. I probably could have gone higher. The portion size on this was also huge, enough for dinner and lunch the next day. (4/5) My boo had the Pad See-eu, it looked pretty tasty and I tried a couple of the noodles. Both solid noodle dishes.   I can't comment on the service inside since we got delivery, but overall the food was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See-eu
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoons
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pad thai

AusDFo6a_D9OfttaxDLvWQ.text: Luckily most Thai food in Vegas is good to excellent and this Thai style noodle house is decent but could step it up a bit by, for example, using better quality jasmine rice and sprucing up the decor - seats and tables are flimsy. For a quick fix or take-out, you could do worse, but with all the competition around (5 other Thai restaurants within a 2 mile radius) it's hard to argue that this particular spot will keep me going back.

2hNXUEB8ISL-xzE5iz5agA.text: 4 stars for the food...5 stars for the value and "bang for your buck!" Came here for an impromptu lunch and ordered take out. She got the Thai Beef Salad (Phone pic): yelp.com/biz_photos/thai... Which is served cold, marinated with lots of flavors here! Huge portions and low prices...I think this was only $6-7?? Not my most favorite version I've tried, but it was good! I went with my favorite dish as always, the Pad Kee Mao aka Drunken Noodles (Phone Pic): yelp.com/biz_photos/thai... It was good...definitely have had better, but the taste is there, spice is hot, and portions are large and very fair at again, only $7 or so? Probably the cheapest I've ever paid for this dish, and one of the largest portions. Also, they aren't afraid to make it hot! This 10/10 Thai Spicy was very close to accurate in my book! To me, this is probably the best bang for your buck Thai I've ran into so far. The portions are fair, prices are cheap, and the to-go order was ready right on the dot, so grabbing for a speedy lunch is a safe bet! Glad I don't work down the street lol

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodles), spicy, flavorful, and cheap!  Big portions at only $7 or so??
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Beef Salad...served cold, marinated with lots of flavors here!  The prices are cheap here...and portions huge!

UvvGE7SuDmWgNMsbNY_ahg.text: Just as good as the Thai Style Noodle House #1, and even better than Thai Style Noodle House #2!    The only other Thai restaurant within close proximity is Nattaya's and this one to me beats her out.  We're presented with good Thai food at a lower cost than the one across the street.  Compared to all three locations this one is the nicest with the most upgrade in furniture.   My favorites are still the specials on the board, especially the salmon that I first tried on Spring Mountain.  I've had the Roasted Duck Fried Rice, Roasted Duck Noodle Soup, Roasted Duck Curry, and if they had a Roasted Duck Ice Cream I'd probably be all over that.  But I like eating in rather than taking out or having them delivered because I like to use the spice, sauce, vinegar that's delivered to your table.  The food is greasy but so good, I've also had the Chicken Satays that comes with the peanut butter sauce which was good and I like to judge a place by their Chicken Satay and sauce.

JJ9nbtoMzVD-vdjVJ2GWIw.text: We were tired yesterday and decided to stop here for dinner. Big mistake, it's the middle of the night and I'm awake.  I know the culprit. MSG!!! Don't eat here if you don't want MSG in your food. The food was boring and bland too. It wasn't even good.

mqtS1dmgEPajZHNcy5qR_Q.text: It used to be my favorite restaurant but not anymore after what I had today. Pineapple fried rice was so wet and plain. They used to have good pad see eeu but this time it's so plain and has almost no flavor to it. Pad Thai was so dry I feel like I'm eating old food. I'm so disappointed!!!! Time to find a new Thai restaurant!!!!

i4DlNBftM5sDk1BbiX1Jmw.text: Love this place. Good food, great prices and good service. Big portions too. Place is always clean. No complaints!

-31vwNIuFWnqTLba2nrQew.text: I'm so happy that I discovered this place!!  It's going to be my new go-to spot that's just around the corner from my house!  I think this place is pretty new, because I haven't noticed it until recently.  Excellent food quality & prices.  The service is fast & friendly.  The location is very small, but extremely clean and very pretty inside.  Most of the soups are $6.50 - 7.    I tried the pork & fish ball soup because of another yelper's recommendation, and I was not disappointed!  I love that they offer 4 different choices of noodles, as I opted for the flat rice noodle.  Other noodle choices include: egg, vermicilli, or thin rice noodle.  Be careful with the little spice rack they bring out, as a little spice goes a long way.  Without meaning to, I overspiced my soup a bit, but it was still wonderful.  I just ended up drinking a lot of water and nursing my runny nose while enjoying my soup.  On my next visit, which will be very soon, I plan to try the Tom Yum soup.  Honestly, everything on the menu sounds great, which offers a full array of Thai dishes in addition to the soup.  They do take out orders, but I'm not sure if they offer delivery.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Khua kai noodles - so simple, but so good!
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo beef noodle soup w/ vermicelli
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork &amp; fish ball soup - delicious

8my0uPq2BxCGxsL0lkoHPA.text: The food is ok.... I order red curry at a 7 and it is NEVER hot as I like..... also if you are in there either the day before or after a "holiday" they DO NOT offer the lunch special.  We went the day after New Year's day and they said it was still a holiday.... I said well technically it is not a holiday.  oh well

PKNd73Cb0797HzJsUTkddg.text: We liked it. It definitely does not deserve a 4 or more, though.  The inside is nice, clean, and modern. We weren't expecting that, especially after we saw the prices. Dishes were mainly around $7.95-8.95, which we thought were more along the lines of fast food prices. The portions, however, were remarkably small. You get what you pay for I guess.  We started off with a papaya salad, at a spicy 8/10. For some reason the portion we got was very very little, compared to some yelp pictures I checked online. Even the cabbage was just a small hunk, but when I asked for more, they were very accommodating.  We got some sort of veggie stir fry flat noodle, which was good, but could've been better. The vegetables in it weren't great, the carrots were sliced too thin, and the portion was again, too small.  The last thing we got was our least favorite. It was a seafood pancake, which I expected to be kind of like the ones you get a Korean restaurants, so I was curious about the Thai version. It was seriously lacking in the seafood, way too much starch or whatever they mixed it with so as a result kind of bland, and FAR too oily. I don't rarely blot food with napkins, but I did so in this situation. Also not a fan of the bed of stir-fry bean sprouts it came on, I think raw would've been more authentic? Just my two cents.  All in all, we really wanted to like it, we kind of liked it, and we hope that in the future they give bigger portions. We both agreed we could've gotten a fourth dish, which shouldn't be the case with any restaurant to feel full unless it's tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. papaya salad. portions are SMALL! this is before we dug in
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy veggie stir fry noodle. it was ok
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood pancake. too oily/starchy, not that good

yhEjzflvb7MrlA83lZ-mXw.text: Last night, I saw Paolo D.'s "check-in" to Komol, and I suddenly had a ridiculously crazy craving for their Herbal salad.  If I was pregnant, I would have made my husband drive to Komol just to pick up a week's supply. Unfortunately, I am not pregnant and due to my crazy soccer mom schedule I can't drive their myself. (I barely have time to write this review!)   Anyways, I was still craving some Thai food so I settled for Thai Style Noodle House for lunch since it is minutes from my own.  I have been here twice, ordering take-out both times.  The restaurant itself is decorated really cute.  but take-out is just so much more convenient for me.  Some of my favorite items are Pad See-eu with beef, Green Curry with chicken, and the Panang with avocado and shrimp.  These dishes are full of flavor and the spice levels are just enough to clear my sinuses and make me sweat/ glisten.  My kids enjoy the chicken chow mein (i know, i know...that isn't Thai food).  There is a good amount of chicken and veggies that they will actually eat!  The items that I did not really care for were the Beef Stew noodle soup and the Chicken Larb.  They were flavorful, however it was just too salty for me to eat more than 2 bites. I chugged my Thai iced tea in seconds, and chased it with a gallon of water. In fact, just thinking about it is giving me a salt headache.  ** Note: some reviews state that there is no restroom. There is one around back.  It isn't inside the actual restaurant, but there is one.  It isn't the most convenient location, but there is no need to torture your bladder. **  The service is quick and friendly, the price is very affordable, and it is around the corner so I'll definitely be back.  (at least until Komol starts offering delivery!)

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern decor, cute and cozy.
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern Interior- seats about 26 total.

yzGOv8_iNzX3xi1phwPbog.text: The servings are generous, the price is affordable, the decor is clean, the servers are nice, and the food is Noms! It's a win, win for Thai food all around.   I love that they serve papaya salad as a side to some of their meat dishes along with the traditional sticky rice. Not too many places do that, but it's how a lot of Thai's would serve you if you came over to their house for dinner. Legit.

ceHS9aFJsF8T0tJhF7dU1w.text: Lazy night, don't want to cook? Order neighborhood Thai. For pick up only!  After reading other reviews, the restaurant should remove the delivery options. Haven't they heard of yelp? Stop making excuses and stop offering delivery. It feels like you, as a patron, are losing a service that ought to be offered. However, if you just knew from the start you couldn't get delivery, it wouldn't be that big of a deal.   Onto the positive... I like how your orders are saved under your phone number. We get the standard, safe dishes like panang curry, pad see ew, tom yum soup. We've tried the basil chicken, drunken noodles, and papaya salad. Of those three, I would only order the drunken noodles again. There are much better basil chickens and papaya salads elsewhere.

yEut8r5TbZgOxKS93x_-rA.text: I dined here a month ago and I remember feeling confused why this place had such high reviews. I asked 8/10 "hotness" on my dish and I got it. The taste, however was just average. This is your typical Thai food; I felt like the dish was just "going through the motions." The portions were smaller than what I'm used to getting from out of state Thai restaurants.  Pros: my dish was actually spicy Cons: taste, portions, price

AwVQ6PD2Hh57bQyy3DPe-A.text: Excellent food and always welcoming of ingredients changed to your order. The Tom Ka coconut soup is outrageous. I can't say how much better this Thai restaurant is compared to others, that all depends on personal preferences, but I can say this place gets the highest score possible from me because of their amazing menu, great chef, and excellent options when I order delivery. Now that the Rampart construction is finished I can get to Thai Noodle House in a hop, skip, and a jump. You have just got to go and try it for yourself! You wont be disappointed!

xJohAWXbnOMBR3QZUHTYgA.text: At first, I was skeptical of trying this place because of their cheap prices. I was prejudice in thinking that it must not be good quality if the prices were this low. This is actually a solid Thai restaurant. Pretty good quality, very affordable and on most nights they deliver. Quite frankly it is the best valued Thai restaurant I've tried. Their portions are fairly generous as well. For the price you will not be disappointed.

pAy4A0HYa4plj_AiLNnzTg.text: The house potstickers are really delicious. The food was great. The waitress was very friendly. My only complaint was that my daughter's meal didn't come out until 10 min after everyone else's meal. I would definitely come back though.

J_k86MjFUrQjftROOnRmVA.text: good food and good priced. Its our go to thai place that is close to the house. They always serve good food and is inexpensive . We ate wonton soup and a radna and it came out to $16 for both of us. The portions are large and some dishes you end up taking home.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton soup
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Radna

eFzHeIHU1yNgVokbsO7NJg.text: Food here is amazing, very authentic, and quick service. Also it's very reasonably priced, definitely one of my go to places for Thai/Chinese food.

UH2a1QYTEIBMb8_WiE1-vw.text: I love this place I can eat here every day I always get Mongolian beef or chicken pad thai spicy level three. It's never failed me. Every other restaurant that has been at this location has failed to last. This one has been here for many years now, so it has proven itself. They actually not only survived, but they expanded into the spot next door. The decor is beautiful, customer service is always good, and food excellent and fast.

VGNhEpFPiXM44RRM0TFndA.text: 3.7 I was really looking for a great Thai place on our new area, this is a maybe. The prices are pretty cheap on the menu, but the sizes are pretty small. We go to another place on the other side of town that is about $1 higher but you get 1/2 a portion more.  The flavors were pretty good. I think the best deal of all we ordered is the seafood wonton, $9.70 huge bowl loaded with seafood, noodles, wontons and veggies. We left hungry, not a good thing.  As I read reviews from 5 months ago I wonder if the new remodel have anything to do with portion size. Because they are not big by any means.

KNmFfCxuxffgWM6782ayJQ.text: Phenomenal Thai-style take-out place. Took less than 10 minutes between placing the order and leaving the restaurant; amazing speed and service for the quality of the food. Chicken Fried Rice, Chicken Green Curry, and Tom Kha Soup are a few of our favorites from Thai Style Noodle House.

1AcAPNgS7hdS-DpELurghw.text: Went for lunch on a Monday, only a few other customers at the time but service was very slow. Took forever to take our order, because the waiter was as sitting behind us eating his lunch. Ordered the lunch special with yellow curry. 2 stars for the curry because it was decent. But the spring roll and wonton they give you is sad. Had to remind them about the soup because they brought our entrees first, by the time the soup came it was cold so it was a waste. I had high hopes for this place because its close by, but I think I will just drive to Pin Kaow next time.

aEaNxaeVSwzGj6ZY9mC4Uw.text: Good but not great Thai food. There aren't that many even good Thai places in Summerlin, so I will be back

uSQwPtFDfErIm3gBwV1y8g.text: Quick and easy review. 2 pick lunch special is amazing. The food is good. Food for the price is amazing. Still working on the dessert list so expect an update in the future. Small location but is currently expanding into the suite next door, so will be able to seat more soon. Thai Style is a good solid place to enjoy some Thai Food, and is located in a great location within the smith shopping center!

L5csCc9220liJ5v91GkybA.text: A very nice small restaurant. Pretty decor and spotlessly clean. Everything we have tried has been good. Lunch specials today. Mint chicken and sweet and sour pork, beef broccoli and Penang curry. You get soup, starter and 2 main dishes for $7.95. Amazing value.

CPA8xfuDK3BUOzXc1KZYKA.text: This place was yummy! I'm always on the lookout for great Thai food, I feel like there are a lot of just mediocre places around Vegas. I randomly came across it online and saw that it was extremely close to my house so gave it a shot. I'm glad I did! I got food to go so can't review the dine in experience, though all the people I dealt with were very friendly. I got the green papaya salad which was delicious but VERY spicy. I usually get a 7 and did that here also. I'd say their 7 is most other places 10! I also got the panang avocado curry with shrimp. This was totally delicious and while still very spicy it was closer to what I  would consider a 7. (I am not a wuss when it comes to spice but my tummy was a'gurgling after this meal!) I will be going back for more soon now that I know it's in my neighborhood...but perhaps scaling back my spice number for once!

mYieHxeOaEgollnODly1SA.text: I was here last week with my girlfriend from reading the reviews in yelp! Have to tell you the food is great with respectable price as well. The menu has illustrated photos on which entrees you would like to choose from. Very clean restaurant. I will be here again soon. Btw, the yellow curry w/chicken is crazy Delicious!!

Na9J7h8ICJt71GjhXwxzWA.text: WOW!  Fantastic Food and great prices.  What more do you need to know?

q3-Rl-n3Owt8Z_6vTuibNw.text: Good thai food.  We had pad thai and a lunch special (chicken).  The service was simple but attentive.  Since moving to Seattle we have missed good Thai and this was better than anything we have found in Seattle.  Price is very reasonable ... compared to prices on the strip it is a real bargain.  Atmosphere is basic diner style.

Ifqkx3BTw1IcgkquchlRng.text: Friendly Staff.  Just expanded to the suite next door so now it is twice as big.  Still only about 15 tables.  Enjoy going there and doing take out as well.  I seem to order the Seafood Pad Thai almost all the time.  I have never been disappointed.  My wife loves the soups.  Good food at great prices.  Quality is consistant as the service.

HSZjpJ79nE_I5zW7V13lCg.text: This is me and my brothers' go-to Thai place, specially since it's so near our house and they're open late (I think 'til 11pm everyday) They have really good food. I haven't had anything from there that I didn't like. I love the combo beef noodle soup and their bbq over rice entree as well as their green curry. I got tofu and the yellow curry with pumpkin and chicken for the boyfriend who is Arab and never had Thai food before and let's just say he couldn't stop raving about it that he had to go get more curry from them the next day :) The staff are very friendly as well, even tho we would always go there late at night. I love that their food is pretty authentic, having experience Chef McDang's (Thailand's only Celebrity Chef) cooking first hand during his demonstration in our school. I'd definitely go there every time I crave for Thai food and would recommend to others :)

0j9CD_0WOFeElpdxb3QzFw.text: Their other reviews are so good, maybe I came on a bad night.  But between us we ordered 2 salads and 2 entrees and only 1 of the 4 dishes was good. We started with the Papaya Salad and Grilled Beef Salad.  The Papaya Salad was mediocre at best, but the Beef Salad was fantastic.  Bright, fresh flavors in the dressing and a nice char on the beef. For entrees we had Duck Pad See Eu and Snapper Pad Ped Snapper.  The noodle dish was awful.  We each only took 1 bite.  It had a funny taste that in retrospect should have prompted me to send it back.  There was just something wrong, like old meat or oil that had me repulsed. The fish itself was light and flaky inside, but the coating was a soggy mess.  It had been fried, then tossed in sauce, but the fried coating wasn't crispy enough so it just ended up with an almost gooey texture that was very unpleasant. Service was good, but our salads didn't come out at the same time, then the entrees came within just a few minutes of getting the last salad.

16VcLz8AQ02LjSAKDSXIIg.text: Had the Thai spicy noodle, it was baaaaad. I asked them for another dish to replace it and they had the chef come out and tell me it was my fault that it tasted "sour" because I put the red chili sauce on it. Obviously that was not the reason, but eventually they did replace it with the panang curry, which was delicious. My friend also had the spicy basil which was really good. Overall I was a disappointed in the service but selective dishes were good. Your call if you want to try this place out.

jkm93ReKl48dOGk4cXDdkQ.text: So you walk in the restaurant & a female worker kinda calls out with "for here or to go", not hello or anything that resembles a greeting to welcome you to their establishment.   The customer service tonight was almost non - existing, except for the male worker who at least checked on us & seemed more personable. Thank goodness the food was good.

CLmtORgi7hruVq1I6r72yg.text: My absolute favorite spot for authentic Thai flavors. The place is clean and the staff are always friendly.

LWxKEI8aFhe98Q0q62CDeQ.text: I don't feel that the food is very authentic or at least not the way I am used to. I've had most of the things on the menu and the only things I like are the soups, basil fried rice, sticky rice, and papaya salad. All of the entrees I've had were weird and not prepared anything like I've traditionally had, plus they give a huge amount of rice per entree and in the same container so the rice gets all soggy. For the price the soups are a good value but everything else isn't because I don't feel that it's edible. The meats are always a weird texture, almost like they used canned meat or something like in the garlic pepper chicken, ginger chicken, even the fried chicken which has rave reviews was a weird orange and also soggy. How do you serve soggy fried chicken?? I've had more entrees and also ones with beef which weren't to my liking. The only things I have liked didn't have meat in them or had tofu. I'll still come here for the soups and basil fried rice, but nothing else.  UPDATE: Gave this place another try and it was even worse than before. With all the options out there and much better customer service elsewhere I won't ever be coming back. Disgusted by the workers here....

oGFSd-TiuS2BDy2htDn99Q.text: Not very happy at all. Came here for the first time today. We got Yellow Curry (worst I've EVER had), Mongolian beef (ok), and Pad Thai noodles (which I really liked). Service was pretty good, other than every time our waiter went to the back and opened the door there was other music BLASTING. You would of thought there was a night club back there. The potatoes were definitely OLD in the curry, my rice was hard, my food got cold really fast and by that time I was so turned off I was ready to go.

AR-svuouj6GBYJmfXjLJgw.text: BEST BROTH EVER!   Some friends and I tried this place thinking we could order pho soup. But, the menu had similar soups and rice places, but not pho. We still tried their lunch special (soup of the day, side and 1 or 2 food items for $7 or $9 - Great Deal!), and I had the roasted duck soup with rice noodles. You can choose between four noodle styles with the soups. Delicious!  The three of us only paid $17, which was great! Service wasn't the best, but it was the norm for a busy lunchtime. Definitely visiting again!

3P7LiQpsIxADhwANiHYF2g.text: Fell in love with the Tom Yum soup!  Cute place, friendly staff, fast and inexpensive-

-lDi8WDuVNzt3Zl-8lbvuQ.text: Lunch specials looked good but orange chicken was 75% batter. Maybe 2 ounces of meat. Egg drop soup tasteless. The staff was very cold and not friendly. Food was just okay.

Ek9ZnvgIWbVw7I_I9yUy1w.text: I am not a fan and probably will not return.  The food didn't seem fresh. I've had thai basil leaf/spicy basil from almost 30 different places and this was the first time I've heard of string beans in this entree however I didn't think I'd mind since it's typically one of my favorite vegetables, but not this time; they tasted dry and dehydrated as if they were old and reused.  Half of the entree box was the entree [mostly vegetables, little meat (this is coming from a light meat eater)] and the other half was overloaded with rice.  On the other hand they had a sign regarding a minimum spend requirement to use a credit card, but they still allowed me to use my card without a fee (at least I didn't see one snuck in there) which I appreciated. Hope others have a better food experience than I did.

SsyWb0P0JBt-MCr1_6_g4Q.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Visited few times already and will definitely come back. My favorite Thai food place.  ATMOSPHERE I remember when I first moved to Vegas, this place was an Hawaiian plate lunch place. It was a bright and welcoming place. Now it looks completely different; modern and clean. I just love walking in here.  SERVICE Better than other restaurants I've been to. Servers here are helpful and very fast. I'm always impressed because there are usually only 2 servers but they provide fast and great service to each and every single customers.  FOOD Their menu is a bit overwhelming because there are so many choices! If you don't know what to order from here, I recommend: -Beef combination noodle (love the soup! you can choose the type of noodles. Egg noodle is my favorite) -Ginger snapper (LOTS of vegetables) -Orange chicken (always fresh and crispy!) Food is usually served within 10-15 mins.  CONCLUSION I have been to many Thai food places but this is my favorite one out of all because of their fast service and delicious food!

esGu97bfyMZNzKsESPGLaA.text: We recently discover the Noodle House. We have eaten there 3 times and yet to be disappointed. Everything is always cooked fresh and served quickly. I highly recommend the orange chicken and the egg rolls. The servers are very friendly and helpful. It has become our favorite restaurant. The only real negative comment I can make is that the service is horrible.

al0nim9o0TycpulfHrrKhA.text: My father works in the area, and after his own ravings, I had to try Noodle House.  When entering, the front room appears to be dirty, or, at least, the windows do. The tables, chairs, yadda yadda are all pretty good. (Honestly? Asian places are best when they look kinda dirty.) But don't let that deceive that.  The food? Pretty darn good. I personally had a bowl of Tom Kha, otherwise known as Tom Yum with coconut milk. The chicken was of good quality, although the amount of mushrooms definitely left me wanting more. The broth had a great taste, and for the value, the dish was massive. However, that's also it's downfall. While the broth was rich and great, I couldn't bring myself to finish it. Because of it's large amount, the broth by itself is a bit rancid and difficult to eat without any other ingredients, mostly because of its silky smooth texture.  My sister had the Appetizer sampler, complete with the great chicken kabobs, well made crab rangoons, typical egg rolls, and sadly disappointing fried tofu. It was too thin and dry to properly eat.  My favorite dish, however, were the flat Thai spice noodles. The beef had a succulent taste, and the fried noodles were delicious and melted in your mouth. It may have been one of the best thai dishes I had ever had -- even the amount of spice was perfect!  The value alone makes Thai Style Noodle House a must visit. While the rest of their Thai dishes are certainly great, I'll definitely be coming back for the namesake.

xYksvIAetmPyMUStzI56oQ.text: I was here for some take out. I ordered Pad See Eu with beef, Seafood Tom Yum and Fried Chicken with fried rice. My bill was $24 ish dollars.   I am surprised by how huge their servings are! My tom yum didn't have any seafood in it:( it also lacks flavor and was very oily. The beef pad see eu was too sweet for my taste, and like the tom yum, lacks flavor. I loved the fried rice that came with the fried chicken. Rice was cooked al dente as well. The chicken was crisp, but I would not be craving for it.   Place was clean and staff were polite.   Overall, not the best thai place but it was decent.

JI6s9KNA8PJlYSq8Mfg4JQ.text: They have such amazing food! I haven't had anything I dislike there. And they always greet us and the kids, since we go there so often. The soup, beef jerky.. I recommend. The orange chicken is out of this world for a kids meals.  The curry chicken, spicy but I eat it every time. Cleans out my sinuses but well worth it

u7CvxWhQVI6tDWWY_KxooA.text: Used to be better, now every time when I come to this place again, I find the portion to be smaller, taste blander and with less veggies-to-noodles/rice ratio. Makes me remember why I don't frequent this place anymore, even though I used to like it a lot before, and to some extend, still feel the same way about their main china town location and the one on jones.

fp8DfwPLVeVoxiDFdo6u4Q.text: Sadly, this place has gone down hill. When they opened the restaurant was bright and stylish. The wall decals are now peeling, the white seats are visibly filthy. The lunch special, which is about the same price as a full size entree, includes a gelatinous egg drop soup. Frankly, it was inedible. You have a choice of appetizer. Egg roll, fried wonton, or fried tofu. Never pick the fried tofu. It's disgusting. My entree was Spicy String Bean with Chicken, which was good, but tiny. It was literally smaller than the scoop of rice included.   Service is hit or miss; they never seem to answer the phone and they more than happy to make you wait half an hour to refill water or bring your check.. When the restaurant is empty.  If you must go here, get takeout of a full size entree, steering away from the chinese dishes. They are inedible. Try the noodle or curry dishes. The thai soups are also good (not the egg drop.)

RVtrhxw0DkkJzdkfCcewDA.text: I am completely disappointed in my visit here. I live right around the corner and dine in or order delivery weekly for the past year. I order the same exact dish every time I come in. Tonight, as usual I get the panang avocado curry with shrimp. The flavor was the same as usual, yet the avocados were black and hard. I was disgusted. When I told them about it she basically shrugged it off and said what it's not suppose to be like that? Of course not!   The way they handled it was very unprofessional. All I wanted was some acknowledgement that they did something wrong and should not be serving food like that. I still paid the full bill and tip $10 on a $30 tab as usall. I wasnt expecting any discounts. But the way they handle the situation was totally wrong. And now they just lost a good customer.

jYNgsFWFubtq0xcwkWeOyA.text: Great place for a vegan and meat eater to go eat! Although beware... I ordered the veggie potstickers and they came with mayo on them.. When I asked the waitress if the mayo was vegan she was like "uhh... Yeah?". Don't lie! I have high doubts that this Thai restaurant has vegan mayo be, for this is not a vegan restaurant... Just so happens they have some vegan options. I would get no mayo if pure vegan and wanna get the potstickers. I always get the drunken noodle with fried tofu and that's amazing!!! Yum

8r0bsgSTCeiMVW7pnHMjQw.text: Great value: Thai food for roughly $7/plate, and it's a big plate! I prefer take out rather than dine-in from here, but all the noodle dishes are solid options (beef pad see eu and chicken pad thai being staples), as winter rolls out I'll be ordering heavily from the diverse soups offered. Service is polite, interior is surprisingly upscale if poorly maintained, and the pricing really can't be beat- especially for Summerlin!

TMmcoEMKb_lmq9bkRLhudw.text: LOVE this place! I just moved back to Vegas and I'm in search of a great Thai place. My husband and I stopped in last night (Saturday) at the recommendation of a coworker who lives in the area, and we really enjoyed the food - this is definitely a solid place for a good Thai dinner!  It's a cozy, welcoming place - very modern decor, with two different seating areas - we asked to be on the left side of the restaurant since nobody else was there, which they had no problem with. Someone came over quickly to get our drink order, and we put our dinner order in at the same time since we generally order the same thing every time we have Thai - chicken tom kha soup to share, chicken pad thai (me) and chicken thai fried rice (him) - all at a 6, or 7 if we really feel like punishing ourselves.   Our food came out quickly. Portions are a perfect size - there was enough tom kha for both of us to have a couple bowls and take home a serving for leftovers - husband finished all of his fried rice, but I had plenty of pad thai leftover. The food was delicious - very fresh and at the perfect spice level! Very flavorful. Their tom kha soup had more of a sweetness than we are used to, but it was so good - a welcome change.   At the end of our meal, someone else came around to check on us and make sure we liked our dinner and to ask if we needed anything. We didn't ever feel like we were waiting for service here, even as they started to get busier. Last thing to mention - prices are very reasonable. I think our bill was just over $20. I love this place and can't wait to come back!

LevIVqGSLmHzdi9bcwhD-Q.text: Went here with my thai friend for some noodle soup. This used to be the old L&L Hawaiian place, which I believe is now located in the old Diner car on Buffalo. I miss that diner, it was good food.  It's not a huge place, but its very clean. There were about 4 tables occupied. One waitress, and one person in the back cooking I believe. I decided to go with the beef Pad See Ew (I can never spell this right). My friend chose noodle soup plus a thai meal she said she can never find here. Don't ask me the name LOL. Later she said it was just OK. My Pad See Ew was really good, sweet flavor on the noodle without that bitterness that sometimes accompanies this when the noodle is overfried.   I will come back, and I will try some other dishes. Easy, cheap cost, good food, good service. A winner in my book for what it is.

xy2XAOtgLDcAO4fvFhfidA.text: This place had food that was very tasty and inexpensive.  I spent a few days in Las Vegas and ate Thai on three occasions at three different establishments.  This was the cheapest and was a close second in terms of taste and quality to "I am Thai Cuisine".  Surprisingly, the highly rated "Arawan" that I ate at the day prior didn't have as good a food as this place.  If you are looking for atmosphere, eat somewhere else.  If you want good Thai food at a very fair price, eat here.

ZpsbD4UpYqDGAXaqqzxrDA.text: Cheap, with vegan options! Yum! I The portions are huge for the appetizer and sides so if you're only a little hungry or have only a little money, so for a side and/or an appetizer. My favorite is the plain fried rice, no egg, with tofu!

_EjKp2YRYDsPNrjXLueYRw.text: Best Thai Food I've had, hands down. I always get it to go, I haven't dined in the restaurant before. I get the Basil Beef and the Chicken Pad See Ew with the Veggie Egg Rolls. I'm a giant baby when it comes to the spicy levels so I always get a 3 and that is usually more than enough spicy for me. The portions are large. The above order is more than enough for my boyfriend and I. The people working are always extremely friendly and it never takes more than 15 minutes to make our entire order. I've never had to wait for anything when I've gone there.   I can't recommend this place enough!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance.

8u8xcWw-eNssSFZ6fZPLXw.text: The best Thai food I have had so far in Vegas. We went there for dinner a few months ago. This little restaurant is located near W lake mead and Rampart in Summerlin. We tried Pad See ew, duck fried rice, pad thai, they were all delicious. The Thai tea was the best thai tea. The price was cheap in my opinion and comes in generous portion. It was the best Thai food I have had. The service was good. I can't wait to go back again.

_pCGOdeccUWEgX2jJ_rArw.text: Whether it's eat in or food to take out and eat at home this place is great! From the Thai fried rice to the chicken noodle soup, yep Thai version, the flavors are on point!  I've eaten from this restaurant for many years and it's always consistently delish! Try it, you won't be disappointed!

6LInUclnYh8_789AVc8OvQ.text: I found a new little Thai Spot close to the house they deliver tried some new things the green curry fried rice was yummy also had shrimp pineapple red curry that was super yummy ordered my go-to Pad See Ew noodles also delicious service is good it's small but cute the wontons were a little different not sure if I cared for those so much but all in all I will be going back

vxKXUH_VeK_SVQxOXsh1dQ.text: Just had dinner here! We started with the potstickers which were awesome. We got the chicken pad Thai and spicy flat noodles for our entrees! The food is just awesome! They are very busy service at first lacked a bit but our food came out quickly and our bill was only $21!! Can't beat that! We will definately be back!
