s1iRIIkPAHGmArrRPxW4EQ.text: Absolutely best Thai food on Vegas! Great menu reasonable prices. Staff friendly, happy and attentive. This is a great place to have dinner. Will be back often

hSNR7D-kyWbJWQk9lGKkgQ.text: Everyone here at Noodle House is awesome. We are always happy to come and dine here the food is great and the service also. I always come for Thai Tea

wFebsvviwTCPtEzgbBXbtg.text: Really nice place close by to my house .... friendly stuff the prices are not that bad, the food is good, it's a nice place to have something fast and good. I really like Thai food and happy to fined this place

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qhqFPN8hOTHkFUnZme34HA.text: I enjoy eating here. Sometimes the wait is a little too long for the food but it's always delicious. The staff is always very friendly! Nothing too fancy just a regular place to have a filling meal.

3YZJQr1qL3iFbWvGTVeTjg.text: Satay chicken is excellent. Shrimp wrap deep fried (appetizer) is good, skin a bit thick to my liking.  Other appetizers are average. Crab Rangoon not my deal.  Pad See Eu is very tasty.  Spicy Thai Noodle is good, 5-level spicy is a bit much for me. I'd go 3 spicy if you're not used to Thai spicy food. They take their spicy food very seriously, I will do a 3 next time for my self.

xA4mmX9ppYDacGun7sDsLQ.text: Thai Style Noodle House is my favorite Thai restaurant in the north west part of town and tied for my second favorite Thai restaurant overall (tied with Ping Pong and behind Lucki Thai). The service is always really good and the food comes fast, but is still prepared well. I have gotten a few different dishes but my go-to is Pad See-eu with chicken and a spicy level of 10. You get a generous portion of food and it is simply delicious. I also recommend the pot stickers. There are other locations in Las Vegas (thaistylenoodlehouselv.c...), but I have only visited this one.

pwnhgCDXW5qhAKUMObteuw.text: I wish this place was closer to me! Joel and I were on this side of town for his work and I used my trusty Yelp app to find a place to have lunch. I've been on a major Thai kick for a while so this place was right up my alley.   The decor you can tell is trying to be fancy, but the diamond buttons on the inside of the chairs are a bit much. I did like the trees painted on the walls with birds.   The service was swift and on point. They even offered me a to go cup for my Thai Iced Tea.   The Noodle House has excellent lunch specials! Which we totally took advantage of. You can choose from one or two items from their menu. On this visit I ordered the Red Curry with Pork. Joel had the Orange Chicken and Beef with Broccoli. Our meals came with egg drop soup and an egg roll. The egg drop soup was really tasty. I had to stop myself from filling up on the soup it was so good. Plus, it didn't have that fake yellow color egg drop soup always has. My Red Curry was delicious. The pork was tender and the Curry itself had the perfect coconut milk flavor coupled with a great spice that wasn't overwhelming. The egg roll was crisp and full of veggies. Joel's Orange Chicken was also seriously tasty. It's normally not my thing, but it was so tender and not overly sweet. I kept sneaking bites of his chicken. Joel's Beef and Broccoli was also very tender and had great flavor.   I wish this place was on my side of town. The price was awesome, but the food was even better!! What a great find on a side of town I rarely visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Chicken &amp; Beef &amp; Broccoli Lunch Special
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Curry Lunch Special
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Drop Soup

VSPRck8sntqo0nr9EUccfw.text: Hit and Miss. Too much of a hit and miss though. When it comes to food, It being great when it is great is not enough to overcome the times it's not by the food tasting as if it isn't cooked enough or has gone slightly bad or old.  For the most part when I've been here the Pad Tai is great and the soups are good too. But a few times iv'e gotten Pad Tai where the meat tasted as if it, as I said was not cooked enough or had started going bad or old. I got shrimp Pad Tai once, tasted very fishy. So I thought i'll just stay away from the shrimp, then one of the chicken Pad Tai's I got tasted the same way.. little old or uncooked. So I probably will stay away from here for some time and hopefully it gets better when I come back or try again.  Also the service is.. nice but casual.

RhPBNnH-MUPy9W-3Gdup7g.text: Dinner Total With Tax: $20.40 - Very cheap!   We ordered:  1. Pad thai with chicken (with spicy #8) $6.75 2. Pad see-eu / pad see ew with beef (with spicy #7) $6.75 3. Vegetarian egg-rolls (4 pcs) $4.95  Taste: 3 stars - Our takeout pad thai was on the dry side - we prefer our noodles moist and juicy! On the other hand, our pad see ew was cooked very well, the noodles were moist and the beef was tender. Yet, both noodle dishes were lacking much salt and sweetness. We were expecting bold, vibrant, Thai flavors, but instead the flavors of the noodle dishes fell flat. I favored the moist pad see ew over the dry pad thai. The veggie eggrolls were crispy, but sadly not stuffed to the max with veggies. However, their homemade sweet and sour sauce was amazing! I would order extra sauce next time.   Value: 5 stars - Wow! 2 dinner portions and an appetizer was $20! They were generous, even on takeout orders. They didn't skimp on any of the noodle dishes, lot's of meat and lots of noodles. It's hard to find decent local food on a bargain budget, but here it is!   Service: 5 stars - The lady was very friendly over the phone and she also gathered up thai bird chilies in fish sauce and jalapenos in vinegar for us, as we requested. Even though we were the last customers in the door for the evening, she was still happy and helpful.   Spice levels: 2 stars - Not very spicy. The spicy levels here are not True to taste. We ordered the pad see ew with spicy #7. In all honesty, we both felt that it was not a True 7, and more like a spicy #2. It wasn't spicy at all. We could of easily asked for a spicy 10 and enjoyed it. We also tried the pad thai with spicy #8, yes, it had minor heat, but more like a spicy #5. It wasn't spicy enough for us. (Note, we are avid spice fans. We love the burn!)  Would we eat here again? Oh hell yus!! Nothing a little salt can't fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A generous portion of beef pad see ew for takeout and only $6.75! A great bargain for dinner (it was bland, just needs salt!)
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad thai was dry and bland. I&#39;d add sugar and more fish sauce to wake up the flavors! But $6.75 is a bargain for dinner
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Insides of the veggie eggroll

658ZsPGVsw4cBWhp5MmYhw.text: The last two times my order to go has taken way too long. 30 minutes and just today 40 minutes. I saw people that ordered after me get theirs first. And tonight one of their excuses was "they called before you came." Well I would've called also if you actually answered your phone during the 10 minutes I was trying to reach someone. After 40 minutes I asked for a refund so I could leave and get food somewhere else. The lady went to the kitchen instead of giving me my refund and oh my food just happened to be ready.  Neither of those times was the place even halfway full.  If you're debating on where to go for Thai food go somewhere else.

Jb1ypD6prFPut3sjkuMvIg.text: Yelp led me here and I am pleased. Portions are like they say -- ample! Excellent value and great flavor. We had Pad Thai with chicken and Yellow Curry with chicken. My boyfriend and I like it spicy (heh) so we got levels 5 and 7, respectively. The spice didn't overtake the flavor and I love me some coconut.  Not too oily, good quality ingredients. Quick service (we called ahead for take out). Would like to return and dine-in perhaps, storefront was cute with a few diners enjoying their own meals.

oOYiO55dugTIQSn7Xa8O4Q.text: First-time review. I came here 30 minutes before 4pm and made it in time for their lunch special. It was a bit quiet when I first arrived, so I had no issues with service. For their lunch special, I ordered the panang curry with an egg roll and egg drop soup for under $6.  The egg drop soup was decent - it lacked a little flavor. The panang curry was delicious and I was able to taste the coconut milk with a little spice, but had more of a watery texture. I'm more of a fan of a thicker soup base with a lot more spice when it comes to curry, but they do give you the red chili flakes to add as needed.   Overall, I like this place especially the price! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg drop soup
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry with steamed rice

l-WlOTPRbx32KdfKMpjUiA.text: Love this place but the service needs improvement. They rush you when ordering over the phone for take out. Dinning in, the service isn't bad but may be a slow process. (Warning) If you are in a rush, consider take out as a first option. Besides that, the food is great. Favorite Thai restaurant with reasonable prices.  Favorite dishes are red curry and tom yum soup

WaERjnszbPU2R5CkrD_HYw.text: Tom Yum Goong is my favorite Thai soup. The ones I have tried at the last few Thai restaurants were not satisfying or just disappointing. When I saw that they have Tom Yum seafood noodle, I was intrigued since I haven't had it with noodles and seafood other than shrimp before.   They have an option of four different noodles. I chose the flat, wide rice noodles. The broth was so satisfying and flavorful. I went with spice level 5 which turned out to be just the right spice level. I loved it with the noodles, fish cakes, squid, etc. After I finished my soup, I already knew I would be back for this delicious, hearty, satisfying soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Tom Yum Noodle (w/flat rice noodles) @ $8.95.

7AQ99ZV3fSY4Yd6Fo7s9_w.text: "Sorry you got sweet and sour sauce so you can't have any soy sauce."  Wow. What kind of place restricts condiments THIS MUCH?  We've been coming here for 3-4 years and the customer service has always sucked but the last couple visits have just been extra horrible. It's not even just this instance, it's just kind of the last straw because of how ridiculous it is?  It's honestly disappointing to see that repeat customers will always be treated worse with each occurring visit :)  edit: we have frequented this place much more then my check ins would lead you to believe.  There was a period of time that we went every other day. That's honestly why this is so upsetting. Supporting a local business is good and all, but not when they run their business like this.  Good job saving that 2cents on the packet of soy sauce (we just wanted one or two lol) And thanks for giving us the sweet and sour sauce spilled all over the bottom of the bag. That was very mature of you :)

2BTZRnOHjgmkUE7GDjgunA.text: Not the first time I've been here. I order the same thing every time and this time it has become difficult to order. My experience this time has left me less than thrilled as a returning customer to never return.   I ordered drunken noodles Pad Thai Beef salad Crab rangoon  Combo fried rice Side of Chinese broccoli tossed in a garlic sauce.  Apparently they want to charge you for a crispy pork but give you no pork and just the broccoli and rice with sauce for $8.50 when the steamed broccoli is $3.50?? So just so you understand the sauce costs more than the vegetable itself.. I don't want rice broccoli and sauce; simply wanted a side of veggie tossed in a sauce that's its, but that's not possible said the "chef".

2dC5TLdVYEDDFsR1oJ6o2Q.text: Ordered to go through a good deliver site. This place is really good and has great prices. We got yellow curry and Pad Ped Snapper. Unfortunately the curry portion is a little small but both meals tasted amazing. We'll be ordering from here again for sure

X0fPWpHteUZ85vRVBh6evQ.text: Came here two days in a row! Its in the same plaza as Smith's. The service was good, gets busy around lunch but I've been able to get a seat fast.  Item: Combination Beef Noodle Soup Portion: Big Flavor: 5/5 Price: $8 Reminded me of Taiwanese beef noodle soup except a little bit more sour and less spicy.   Item: Mango Sticky Rice Portion: Small Flavor: 3/5 Price: $5 The ratio of mango to rice was disappointing. They gave small slivers of mango compared to the bowl of rice.   I wouldn't go back for their dessert but that soup is killer.

wcakvD7YjP0VuJOgz95cbw.text: I loved the decor of this Thai restaurant; they are definitely trying to be different from your typical Asian eatery. Although the decor was different, their food remained very authentic. I enjoyed eating their yellow, red curry and their pineapple fried rice, it was delicious! The only complain I had is that they do not ask you how spicy you want your curry to be. Most of the restaurants I have been to they always give you the option for it. Ambiance: 8 out of 10 Food: 8 out of 10

AQDWLMjEsj_RNQZKOWktgQ.text: Amazing food for super cheap with great service! One of my favorite thai places in Las Vegas for sure

Sn5BluTPuDteFCaPDLik7w.text: This place will only ever be eaten by me again.....oh wait never. Their tom kha has canned mushrooms and huge chunks of tomato. Wtf. I ordered pad kee Mao which I don't even know what they call it here but it was pretty much all cabagge and carrots with like a small sprinkling of noodles. Double wtf. You can tell these people are cutting corners and it is affecting the quality of their food. I won't give it one star cause it wasn't roach infested and for some people who have NO idea what good thai food is would possibly dine here, but for me it's a no go.

wQUS2MIHwuj3jfEOljk8KQ.text: I'm a regular here.  Food is always fresh and prepared well. Can't go wrong with their noodle dishes. I ordered the duck fried rice and it was spectacular.

CtovhvObmCGxZf-J8_iXjA.text: This review is on service alone. We felt as if we were bothering the servers. They were chatting the whole time, sitting at a table for 2. We were the only guests in the restaurant and we had to interrupt their conversation for a refill of iced tea and then another time for our bill.

flw8AVK4hEBTBvOLqVN3HA.text: Food was awesome! Just wish the waitress woulda given me more then just one cup of water during my meal. Seriously need to have a chat with their waitresses about customer service and how to check on customers i got a water before my meal and no refill untill she brought me a to go box. I have been a waiter before so i know first hand keeping up with drinks is the easiest part of the job, if you can't do that then get out of the food service buisness for reals!

tky4QZ1ZOmH0jE2BSqXXig.text: Food to go was very good.  Last time we got spicy number 7, which is our regular order most places and it was a bit too spicy for me, this time went for spicy number 5 and it was perfect for me. Chicken Satay a bit dry, but good sauce. Larb was very tasty, although the lettuce was chopped into the dish instead of wrap style. Massaman curry had a great balance to it, although not a huge amount of chicken. Very tasty duck fried rice. We would definitely order again. Lots of other items I would love to try.

FintLyviWqyp7Lpyp2sCVg.text: Thai heaven .... The food is delicious... Enuff said. I thought i had to go alllll the way to spring mountain location but not no more.. Awesome that they are here and the place is   Busy.

IBCdjmsvn21nhFPBXeQA9g.text: Love this place. Good food and fair prices. The staff is friendly. The location is nice and clean. We eat here all the time and recommend it to everyone.

cJ1I07PufUoywjvDZeoe7g.text: Was is the mood for Thai Food and found this hidden gem. The pot stickers are the best I've ever had, chicken satay was tender and tasty. For our main course we had the beef noodle soup and chicken Pad Thai.....amazing!!!! You are dumb not to try this place!

bWnDcwLbS5btNHGG04_kPg.text: I like the Thai fried rice because it is a good price for a decently large portion which makes it easy to pick up for dinner and have as leftovers the next day. But I've noticed if you don't say "Thai fried rice" and just "fried rice" they do taste different so be careful of that. Most other things I've tried are decent but not amazing like the pad seeu is better sometimes than others because at times it has a bitter after taste even when it tastes good at first. Their crab wontons are pretty good (hard to mess those up) and their Thai soup has good flavor.

4-aOd25jqHsJojJKe_eUrQ.text: The perfect little gem in Summerlin. I just had dinner there yesterday & I want more! The Tom Kha soup has a lighter, fresher taste than most I've tried, and the chicken & shrimp Pad Thai was delish. Can't wait to try  other items on the menu.

cKcudMrmt9VFwMxSyajgDQ.text: I've done dine-in and to-go several times and haven't had a problem. I noticed they extended their restaurant. I walked in and asked for seating for two. Ended up being seated in the extended portion to be forgotten. The woman who sat me dropped the menus and was long gone and almost 10 mins pass when i decide to walk out. I think it's best for them to turn people away at the door than forget about them in the back.

gs4QARGVhmbktCA_LeQx1A.text: Went here for my co-worker's farewell dinner and just wow. They have great service (my food came 10 ish minutes after ordering) , all the waiters are super funny and kind and the food is delicious. The price is pretty good too. There's nothing on the menu that is above ten dollars. The Pad Thai, Fried Chicken over Fried Rice and the Duck Soup are some of my favorites. And the best part? They have fried ice cream! Not those crappy fried ice cream dipped in cereal, but ones they actually fried. Will definitely keep coming back!

SJ8qZOqMXXe2CAiZtvz89Q.text: Great thai food at really affordable prices! Can't go wrong here my new spot for some really great soups and noodles.

dWc3vP4agRDGiFoTlUEh_g.text: Stunned by how good this place is!  I am a die-hard Le Thai person, but I have long needed a place where I can get my Pad Kee Mow fix both closer to home and open on Sunday.   Thai Noodle House nailed it.  We will be back.

jklfCRUEZQ3agqYyGhlP7Q.text: It is hit and miss at this restaurant.  While the Chef specials are good, the appetizers and soups leave something to be desired.  Thai food is better than its Chinese food unless you're choosing take out.  Gr8 menu selection and efficient service.  Casual atmosphere and  decor.  Good value in Summerlin for some fast Thai food.  I like the ginger steamed snapper spiced half spiced and the salmon dishes.

Z3KcGhyA3bb3KAe1KMREZQ.text: So I went in with my 3 kids and we been before I dnt know what happened this time we order our usually sticky rice n beef jerky and it sucked so bad the sticky rice was a disgrace it crumbled in our hands from being to wet or I dnt know what I couldn't eat my 3 hungry kids try to eat they crumbled everywhere as it was falling from there hands and it's suppose to be a hand meal I asked the worker she said supposed to be like that then 15 minutes later she tried to bring a new one when I ordered 4 witch it came out after the beef jerky at different times.....and said this one is free I said dnt worry it was insulting the rice was unedible we left hungry.....

kkfjN9BgIEM4Jy1HtNMRQw.text: The best Thai food for your buck, hands down. My mother has owned a Thai restaurant for over 25 years and this place has great food! The value is unbeatable and the service is great too! I highly recommend this restaurant. I haven't tried the other locations as this is the closest one to my house. It's my husband and I's go to spot when we decide to eat out. They will customize your order any way you'd like, my usual is Eggplant with Green Bean stir fry, love it!

CYqLW7TkUrwG6RjWCnMQPQ.text: Just went for my first time. Food is amazing! Prices are fair too. Just wish I was treated better. The lady who helped me was rude and decided to help other customers behind me before even greeting me. If it weren't for that, I would have given five stars. Knocked off two stars because I was so offended.

56wyYF55YtS6ak4WZwx0Hw.text: Best thai place in town. I would highly recommend Tom Ka, red curry and pad thai. I went to Nattayas and it was good but twice as expensive.

6cJ3NqOOaDtWi_2NHZ194g.text: Found this place here on yelp and my wife and I love it! Great food, but I've only had the Duck Curry because I'm hooked on it! My wife has had several noodle dishes and has loved them all...great place!
